Our expertise and technology sits at the intersection of optical fiber sensing networks, integrated photonics and machine learning. More than a sensor company, FiberSense is building out a global scale sensing platform using our patented VID+R™ (Vibration Detection and Ranging) technology. Job Title:
Sales Account Executive - Singapore
- job post
Job Description:
ABOUT UNRAVEL CARBON

Unravel Carbon is an enterprise software that helps companies track and reduce their carbon emissions, focusing on Asia, based in Singapore.

It is the first AI-powered decarbonization platform in Asia that converts any company’s accounting data into full supply chain carbon data in seconds, generates climate solutions automatically and auto-populates regulatory disclosure reports.

We aim to accelerate the participation of all companies, big and small, in the global fight against climate change. And we want to do it the 21st century way—autonomous, painless, and beautiful.

Unravel consists of a team of software engineers, data scientists, founders and climate experts with a passion to solve the world’s most pressing issue—climate change.

Collectively, our leadership team has launched and invested in multiple companies, and are now combining their experience and knowledge here at Unravel.

We are backed by some of the world’s best funds and investors such as Y Combinator, Sequoia, Alpha JWC, Rebel Fund and Bradley Horowitz.

Unravel was founded in Q4/2021 with headquarters in Singapore.

ABOUT THE ROLE
An experienced SAAS / Tech Sector Sales Account Executive and growth role. Must be comfortable working independently and responsively in a fast pace and changeable environment. Applying a mix of strong soft and hard skills to discover, engage and win over, key individuals at the right operating levels within target enterprises; winning commitment to adopt the Unravel Carbon Platform. Must be passionate about climate-tech for a better future.
Developing and executing sales plans for target markets, sectors
Contribute to executing sales and resource budget plan
Identify and act on new market development opportunities as they arise
Contributing to the overall development of Singapore as a market for Unravel Carbon
Applying research to identify the key persons in any given target enterprise
Leveraging knowledge of the required tech stack to drive efficient sales lead engagement, conversion and retention
Demonstrate astute commercial and business development acumen
Generate pitch and proposal decks and offers (creative support provided where needed)
Exceptional communication skills
ABOUT YOU
Demonstrated track history in SAAS or similar B2B sales capacity with demonstrable achievement of sales targets
Willingness to learn, be self motivated, and thrive in uncertainty; you would the first boots on the ground in Singapore in an early stage startup, be prepared to venture into unknown territory, collaborate and learn
Can apply aptitude to learning to the climate consulting to a degree to engage independently on the platform subject matter with impact and confidence
Detail-oriented, task-focused, and exceptionally results-oriented
Required skills:
Research and analysis
Skills / Exp with MS PowerPoint / Google Slides / HubSpot & other tech platforms as needed
Exceptional written communication skills
Lateral thinker - can see opportunities and ‘join the dots’ when searching for multiple key contact points in a large, multi divisional enterprises’.
Tenacity; can push through objections to find novel and creative ways to connect with target enterprises
Beneficial skills:
Existing knowledge of Climate Change / Carbon Assessments
YOUR WORK STYLE
Focused and driven - achieving your objectives is critical to you.
Proposition minded, communicating ideas in a sales and customer centric way.
Analytical and detail-oriented, and fully capable of navigating and combining various data points to pull out key insights to generate and execute actions plans
Self-starter (proactive and independent) with an ability to prioritise different assignments and tasks to meet deadlines
Comfortable working in a collaborative environment
Eager to think outside of the box and creatively problem-solve
YOUR PREFERRED BACKGROUND
A Bachelor’s Degree in Business Management, Sales or Marketing or a related discipline, or 5+ years working experience in related Sales Account Executive / biz dev role.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU
Competitive base and commission package with uncapped accelerated commissions for overachievers.

We offer an exciting challenge for a purpose-driven person who thoroughly enjoys learning and takes up responsibilities in a multi-cultural, primarily virtual, and pioneering organisation.

We nurture a culture that allows you to thrive, where your skills can be honed and your ideas will be heard, and where collaboration across teams and with global partners is the default.

Job Title:
AVP, Content Designer, Design Standards, Institutional Banking Group, Group Design (ID: WD53798)
- job post
Job Description:
What you'll be doing:
Your goal will be to create amazing content for our web and mobile apps. What do we mean by amazing? It's content that helps our users achieve the task at hand faster. If your content is good, it will become invisible. It will be so clear, succinct and helpful that our users will forget they're reading and simply focus on what they have to do.
In addittion to doing hands-on work on key projects, you will get a chance to lead and nurture a small team.
Here's what your week might look like:
Your week may start with 1:1s with your team. Clearing blockers for your team and nurturing relationships within and beyond projects.
But you will also get to do hands-on writing. You'll spend time with product designers, researchers, and business owners to understand the goals of a new feature or the re-design of an old one.
You'll own the customer journey from a copy perspective and make sure there are no gaps in UX across all channels and touchpoints linked to the products.
This role is regional, so you'll get to work with fantastic people from all over the region. The content you'll create will need to be internationalised and localised. Sometimes, you'll need to make changes to the source content to ensure it makes sense for another country.
Most importantly, we don't want you to become a content-generating machine (AI can do that). We want you to be strategic and create impact and stakeholder buy-in for bigger and better things to come.
Here are the experience and skills we'd love you to have:
You've been writing professionally for 5+ years.
You have some content design experience.
You've been a manager or mentored writers.
Bonus:
You have collaborated with tech teams: developers, testers, scrum masters, etc.
You have your own blog or website.
You have experience with product localisation tools and processes.
Your team and career:
This role sits within the Design Standards team, and is based in Singapore. The Design Standards team creates our design language system and defines and steers the way we design digital services at DBS. The team covers eight countries, Consumer and Institutional banking, and Middle Office Management group (internal tools).

As your career with us progresses, you will help to increase UX and content design maturity at DBS and grow the content design team at Institutional banking.
About the design team

Hi, we are the DBS user experience design team

We create digital products that deserve to be built because they solve real problems in an impactful way with empathy.

How we design

We go beyond numbers

Every dollar means something. No one actually wants money. We want what it can give us. So we acknowledge that money is not really about money. We inject emotion into our products to go from transactional to magical.

We have one profound idea

Because ambiguity is the enemy of good user experience. What is our unique value proposition? Would adding another feature dilute the idea or make it stronger?

Connect with us

https://www.instagram.com/dbsuxd/

About Omdia
Omdia advises some of the world’s largest telcos, network vendors and technology vendors on market strategies, trends, and best practice from across the TMT (telecoms, media and technology) industry. We deliver these services around the fastest moving technologies through either our subscription or consulting divisions.
The Service Provider consulting team provide a range of custom research services which includes total addressable market analysis, competitor analysis, customer insights, product benchmarking and business strategy development. We also provide targeted custom marketing services which help our clients position themselves for growth, through the design and delivery of messaging strategies, the production of thought leadership white papers, case studies and public speaking, and the provision of audience extension and message amplification capabilities from across the Informa Tech brands
At Informa Tech, we believe that technology innovation is key to driving positive change in our society. We believe that digital inclusion underpins progress. And we believe that diversity in tech is central to a thriving industry.
Our aim is to inspire the global technology community to build a better world by informing, educating and connecting them through world-class research, training, events, and media.
We sit at the heart of the tech community with specialisms in emerging tech/AI, enterprise IT, cyber security, service providers/NextG, critical communications, media & entertainment and marketing technology.
Leveraging over 100 trusted brands, we offer an unrivalled global networking community and platform for technologists and innovators to be inspired and reach their full potential.
About the World Broadband Association
The World Broadband Association (WBBA) is a multilateral, industry-led association, providing leadership for digital broadband across the next decade.
Our objective is to overcome industry challenges and support the drive towards the provision of broadband networks and services for all. With a goal of accelerating the healthy development of the industry, with sustainable benefits for stakeholders, end users, and society.
Since it’s official launch in June 2021, the WBBA has grown rapidly in terms of number of members and the delivery of a wide portfolio of research, event and digital media activities designed to raise brand awareness, increase influence and industry leadership and grow the membership. The initial success of the WBBA presents opportunities for further accelerated growth, both in terms of new member acquisition and delivery of value to existing members.

Project delivery
Focus on the overall running of the World Broadband Association (WBBA) engagement, for which Informa Tech provides secretariat services as well as research, events and digital media.

About Doctor Anywhere:
Doctor Anywhere (DA) is on a mission to be the largest tech-enabled, omnichannel healthcare provider in Southeast Asia. First launched in Singapore in 2017, DA aims to bridge gaps in the healthcare ecosystem through developing innovative solutions and technologies. In 2021, DA raised SGD$88 million in Series C fundraising (August 2021) and acquired Doctor Raksa, the biggest telemedicine platform in Thailand which further strengthened our foundation for telehealth and healthcare offerings. Today, DA is present in Singapore, Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, and Vietnam, serving more than 2.5 million (and growing) users across the region.

At DA, we believe in the value of innovation and collaboration. Grounded in our motto of “Keep Going, Keep Growing”, our team strives towards excellence every day, and values diversity in perspectives brought by every member. Together, we bring accessible and efficient healthcare to your doorstep!

With Doctor Anywhere driving to become a product-led organization, our Product team is responsible for shaping our product strategy, and striving to bring the best products and services to both our users and the future of Doctor Anywhere. Our team consists of passionate and talented and ambitious Product Managers and Designers who continuously evolve our products to maximize business value and improve user experience

We are seeking a Senior Product Manager to join our Product team to enhance our B2C product capabilities serving the needs of the healthcare industry.

As a Senior Product Manager, you will:
Define product vision and scale DA's suite of healthcare solutions
Act as the voice of the users - Leverage data, user research, market analysis, and competitive landscape to drive product insights
Create a product strategy to maximize business value and user satisfaction, align the strategy with the rest of the company, drive the implementation of the strategy, and measure success
Collaborate with business stakeholders, Engineering, and Designers to build a feature or product that solves users’ pain points
Break down complex business requirements into actionable solutions and develop user stories, roadmaps, and release plans

Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
5+ years of experience in product management
Experience in bringing at least one product from conception to launch
Experience in managing consumer-facing applications across digital platforms such as native mobile apps, responsive web, interactive platforms
Clear understanding of data, analytics, metrics and statistics
Experience in working with engineering team and in Agile/Scrum development process
Self-starter with relentless curiosity and creativity in pursuit of growth

Preferred Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Human Computer Interaction, or an equivalent technical field
A/B testing experience
Experience in working in an ambiguous environment

Job Title:
APAC IT Security Manager - Singapore
- job post
Job Description:
'Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions is at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.

Thales established its presence in Singapore in 1973 to support the expansion of aerospace-related activities in the Asia-Pacific region. Throughout the last four decades, the company grew from strength to strength and is today involved in the primary businesses of Aerospace (including Air Traffic Management), Defence & Security, Ground Transportation and Digital Identity & Security. Thales today employs over 2,100 people in Singapore across all its business areas.”

Responsibilities:
Reporting to Asia DIS Security Director is responsible & accountable for Security Governance and Oversight for Thales DIS Asia Business, R&D and Outsourced activities (Manuf / SW Dev etc).

Acting in accordance with the Corporate Security Management System and Policy to support the related site security management on all aspects of personnel, physical, logical, IT security at all Asia R&D / Outsource Manuf activities.
Ensure the oversight of information security for the related sites in Asia region are in accordance to required org security requirements and compliance to applicable certification and regulatory requirements.
Serves as a SME for the related stakeholders in Asia region in regards to any security queries, issues and provide appropriate solutions in line with the required compliance and risk level
Support the sites in obtaining accreditation and then ensure ongoing compliance with the security regulatory requirements in respect for business / R&D security activities as per applicable standards such (CC/EMVCo , ISO27001, GSM-SAS etc).

Perform Risk Assessment and regular audits for both internal and external stakeholders as per Accreditation or Corporate Standards and recommend and verify the implementation of solutions/controls.
Ensure that Security risks and issues are appropriately managed in a measurable way and in accordance with Corporate policies and customer requirements

Provide inputs and recommendations to management and take necessary steps to propose the security controls needed to protect information and assets as well as all business data and information of Thales customers and partners.
Act as the Tactical Process Manager between personnel responsible for security and organizational leaders to help organization achieve its strategic security objectives.
Formulate security audit plan with Asia Security Director and perform internal cross-site audits in Asia region to ensure that controls and audit trials are in place to protect company assets.
Monitor all security activities (Logical & Physical) and advice the management team on all matters concerning card/secured documents production security, IT system security as well as outsourced activities.
To work with all business owners and departments to ensure the security requirements and deployment of security framework in all production sites as well as outsourced manufacturing activities.

IT security knowledge & experience

Demonstrates great maturity and holds a very high degree of integrity, confidentiality and discretion;
Strong interpersonal and communication skills required;

Independent, approachable and analytical

The
Hydragun
Culture
Hydragun provides a growth-focused environment where you are loved and appreciated for doing purposeful and meaningful work. You will have the opportunity to have your ideas challenged, refined and realized; and are encouraged to pursue mastery and excellence in your chosen areas of expertise

We believe in acknowledging and rewarding contribution, which is why we are committed to doing whatever it takes to make Hydragun a success – because Hydragun's success is also our success.
Our Mission
Our mission is to make premium recovery essentials for everyone who wants to feel good, get better and live their best life.

By 2025, we aim to help 1 million people feel better.
Our Peak Performance Culture
We believe that no matter who you are and what you do, being able to achieve peak performance will help you do your best work, to live your best life.

That’s why we’re putting together a dedicated and resilient team who wants to do their best work everyday and actualize our vision of helping a million other people feel better.

To empower and help others, we need to lead by example. That means peak performance must be an integral part of our everyday lives in the team. Habits, routines and practices that help us perform at our best—physically and mentally. Think meditation, great fitness routines, productivity hacks, book sharing discussions, that’s our water-cooler talk.
Our Values
While you may instinctively scoff at the idea of core values (we know, we were like that too). The reason many people treat this as “corporate fluffery” is because core values are often nothing more than just a pretty poster on the wall.

That’s why we stripped it down to the bare bones. We asked ourselves what are the two most important things we want in our team? What are the key traits that will propel Hydragun to the next level? They are:
Growth
Always look for new ways to improve personally and professionally. Push your boundaries. Be better!
Ownership
Own your work. Own the brand. Own the mission. Take pride in what you do. Make it count.
Our Plan to take on Industry Giants
As a performance tech company, our goal is to create products that help people perform better in
their day-to-day lives. Starting with the massage gun. The massage gun space is new, with a couple of big players dominating it with high prices and huge investor funding.

For us, we rely on our scrappiness, resourcefulness and years of experience in building e-commerce brands
to shake up the industry. There is an opportunity for Hydragun to revolutionize the massage gun space. And we’re grabbing it.

We can only do that if we have the right people with the right skillsets and mindset.
Who Should
Apply?
If any of these get you excited:
Purposeful and meaningful work
Freedom and autonomy to bring your ideas to reality
Achieving mastery and excellence in your expertise
An open, honest, and positive workplace
Becoming a leader
Work with teammates that inspire and support you
Then we’ll work well together like peanut butter and jelly. At Hydragun, you can do your best work at your best physical and mental state with the best people.
What to
Expect
You’ll have the flexibility and autonomy to make your own decisions. We are open to ideas, discussion and feedback. We recognize that productive failure and struggle are great opportunities to grow. We encourage risk-taking.

However, with great freedom comes great responsibility.

We don’t tolerate mediocrity. We expect you to show up. And most importantly, to actively contribute to building a positive work culture.

Ask for help. Offer help. Be honest with feedback. And be gracious when receiving them. Build relationships.
‍
Foster goodwill. Question assumptions. Be proud of your work, yet not prideful. And be generous with praise and kind words.

At the end of the day, we’re working towards a common mission. Your success is everyone’s; and everyone’s success is yours.
Join Our
Growing Team
Creative oracles, marketing mad scientists, writing wizards, business development ninjas, customer happiness heroes, and visionary leaders. We’re building an A-team of star players to work on our vision and mission. If you believe in the power of peak performance and want to make a real impact in the world, we might be a great fit. Submit your application for the available positions below and let’s talk. We look forward to changing the world with you.

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.

Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

Facilities Coordinator (Tech Company)
Work Dynamics - Integrated Facilities Management

Location: CBD

What this job involves:
Providing onsite support
You will be the upper facilities management’s trusted right hand on all facilities-related activities. You’ll do this by performing routine site inspections to ensure all building processes and best practices are implemented and maintained.
Where can processes be improved? How can we save costs? These are questions that will be at the forefront of the team’s thinking. You, too, will always have an eye on this, contributing suggestions as they arise.

You’ll also lend the team a big hand by providing admin support including front desk receptionist duties, basic housekeeping and vendor coordination. Also, part of your job scope is to hit the client key performance indicators and meet service level agreements as per the client agreement.

Meeting the clients’ facilities needs
At JLL, we put client satisfaction at the front and centre of everything we do. If you share our values, we will be more than happy to work with you. In this role, you’ll be responsible for working closely with clients and vendors onsite to identify their facility-related enquiries and requirements. Your planning and budgeting skills will also be vital to the job, as you’ll take part in the procurement of vendors and services from time to time.

Making everyone safe and risk-free
Do you value workplace safety? If so, you’ll be a perfect fit for the job. In this role, you will assist to ensure everyone’s health and safety by keeping safe workplace procedures in place and order. You’ll also be expected to carry out these procedures, as needed.

At the same time, this role puts you on the first line of defence against risks. As such, you will help implement and manage risk management programs, disaster recovery and business continuity plans. You’ll also be expected to follow escalation and incident reporting procedures and comply with the firm’s guidelines and strategies.

Sound like you? To apply, you need to be a:
Passion for service
Do you have at least 1 year of working experience in a commercial / tenancy-based office facilities environment or other related fields? Do you have an understanding of local occupational health and safety requirements, critical facilities environment and vendor management? Are you knowledgeable in various commercial office mechanical and electrical (M&E) systems? You are what we’re looking for!

Team player
JLL’s unmatched excellence is only made possible by team work—a core value we want you to possess. As the facilities coordinator, we expect you to support the team and work well with others toward achieving targets. Likewise, you must have a proven track record of flawless project execution, all while following company standards and procedures. Ensuring that the team practices our ‘I am JLL’ core behaviours is also under your mandate.

Client focused enthusiast
It is important that you can easily interact with the general client staff and vendors to deliver efficient services. We’ll also count on you to address conflicts and conflicting priorities effectively. Likewise, you must be an excellent and resilient communicator who faces customers with a smile at all times, even when times get rough occasionally.

If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements below. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

Personalized benefits that support personal well-being and growth:

JLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health.

About JLL –

We’re JLL—a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 102,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability and corporate social responsibility. That’s why we’re committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We’re using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people, and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we’re honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we’re headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

Secretlab is an international gaming chair brand seating over a million users worldwide, with our key markets in the United States, Europe and Singapore, where we are headquartered.

You will be a trusted key leader of our Global Finance team, playing an integral role in leading strategic tax decisions and valuably contribute to the growth and long-term vision of the tax functions. You will be the subject expert to the business in all tax advisory matters, minimizing tax controversy risks and advising on effective tax strategies consistent with overall Business objectives.

You will be part of a team that oversees the global financial operations of Secretlab and its collaborative programs with world-renowned brands, including Game of Thrones, Batman, Cloud9, Team Secret, as well as international esports organisers such as Riot Games for their League of Legends global tournaments.

Adopt a proactive approach in evaluating and reviewing existing tax structure, policies and operational processes to maximise Business's tax efficiency and savings
Build strong relationships across Finance and Business teams to develop a good understanding of our business model, provide tax guidance in department-wide initiatives and identify opportunities for tax optimization
Provide inspired leadership, coaching and developing the Senior Tax Associate to achieve and exceed business goals

Bachelor of Accounting & Finance or relevant courses of study Reporting directly to our Finance Controller, you will be the key person overseeing all tax matters.
You should have at least 5 years of overseeing full spectrum of tax activities, equipped with the adequate VAT/ GST knowledge
Have direct and indirect tax knowledge on US, EU, UK, Singapore and Asia Pacific
Solid understanding of transfer pricing principles and experienced in transfer pricing compliance matters

Tech-savvy with working experience utilizing accounting & ERP software (preferably NetSuite)

Job Description:
ByteDance will be prioritising applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require ByteDance's sponsorship of a visa.

About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
At ByteDance, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for millions of users across all of our products. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at ByteDance.

Team Introduction
As a Tech Recruitment Sourcing Specialist at DataAILab, you will connect with the business to learn how TikTok and its affiliates grow into one of the most popular applications in the world. You may also collaborate with regional and global human resources professionals to implement various projects to reach the recruiting goals. You will have the unique opportunity to partner with multiple stakeholders to support our continued rapid growth. The ideal candidate is someone who is driven, hungry to learn, and excited to tackle recruitment challenges, initiate ideas and approaches to resolve the issues, and is action-oriented. As a team, we continue to partner closely with our business to ensure we are able to value add and make impact to the company and our users.

Responsibilities
Manage pipelines via channels such as sourcing, screening and referrals for multiple, complex searches to find and engage key technical talents of all levels.
Collaborate closely with the Recruiting team (Recruiters, Coordinators, other Sourcers) & hiring managers throughout the recruitment lifecycle to ensure business's needs and goals are fulfilled.
Develop a holistic business understanding and manage stakeholder relationships including HR, hiring managers, and external partners.
Own and drive innovative sourcing strategies, initiate new projects and/or optimise current processes to improve recruiting process and efficiency
Conduct complex data analysis and share up-to-date, accurate, and value-adding market intelligence to business leaders to support business growth.

Manage candidate communication throughout the recruitment process and providing feedback.
Ensuring a great candidate experience and advocate TikTok as a great place to work for all candidates.
Minimum Qualifications
Sourcing experience in a high-volume environment (via search firm or in-house recruiting environment)
Proven experience with research/sourcing tools (ie. Boolean, LinkedIn and other alternative sourcing techniques) to identify & engage passive candidates within the internet industry talent space.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with capability to analyze high amounts of data to support business strategies and decisions.
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to build rapport quickly with stakeholders and communicate effectively across all levels of the organization internally, as well as externally.
Experience partnering with recruiters, hiring teams and external partners across different offices.
Ability to contribute in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment and prioritize multiple functions and tasks.
Fresh graduates are welcome to apply
ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

We are looking for a Software Developer to join our dev team. Bring your ideas—the wilder and the crazier, the better—and establish Flo as the go-to renewable electricity retailer in Singapore.

Full-time · Singapore or Remote

David Attenborough
About Flo
Hi, we’re Flo, and we are on a mission to switch as many people and businesses as possible to clean, renewable energy.
We do that by making clean energy as cheap as conventional energy, investing in smart technology to reduce our operating costs and passing the savings to our members. And yes, it's not impossible.
We are pushing boundaries and breaking conventions of the traditional electricity retailer. To do so, we are looking for like-minded people who share our passion for technology and sustainability. You might be the one we are looking for!

What you will be doing:
Your main focus will be on developing, improving and maintaining our digital products across several modern tech stacks running on a cluster built with a robust microservice architecture. You will be surrounded by an international team that strives to push each other forward. You will become an integral part of this by also sharing your own knowledge and expertise. In addition you will also work closely with our designers, product owners and stakeholders to help shape the future of Flo Energy.
You will be a good candidate if you are:
… a quick learner who values personal development by keeping up-to-date with the latest developments in tech.
… a passionate developer and you like motivating the developers around you (by sharing your knowledge and your enthusiasm for technologies).
… someone with experience in JavaScript (React and TypeScript) and Java (Kotlin and Spring) systems.
… well experienced in version control systems (git, Bitbucket).
… experienced building GraphQL APIs.
… someone with excellent HTML and CSS knowledge.
… familiar with software testing methodologies and frameworks.
… someone with a UX-oriented mindset to achieve the best user experience.
… willing to learn how we designed, manage and improve our highly available distributed micro service cluster (Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Tanka) to serve thousands of customers in Singapore, 24/7.
… understanding of CI/CD principles.
Culture and benefits:
Get involved in product development from the ground up to chart the future of Flo.
Work in an open-minded and dynamic environment with a talented team.
Budget and time to take on professional development courses.
Work on our great location in Telok Ayer and enjoy flexible work from home options.
Enjoy an attractive compensation package, generous time-off and work-life balance.

DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™DSM – Bright Science. Brighter Living.™

Royal DSM is a global, purpose-led, science-based company active in Nutrition, Health and Sustainable Living. DSM’s purpose is to create brighter lives for all. DSM addresses with its products and solutions some of the world’s biggest challenges while simultaneously creating economic, environmental and societal value for all its stakeholders – customers, employees, shareholders, and society at large. DSM delivers innovative solutions for human nutrition, animal nutrition, personal care and aroma, medical devices, green products and applications, and new mobility and connectivity. DSM and its associated companies deliver annual net sales of about €10 billion with approximately 23,000 employees. The company was founded in 1902 and is listed on Euronext Amsterdam.

More information can be found at www.dsm.com
What you'll do:
This job is required for conducting microbiological testing on premixes, raw materials, environmental samples and other related samples to meet both internal and external requirements.
Your key responsibilities:
Key areas of accountability/responsibility
1. Ensures smooth running of the routine microbiological work in the QC microbiology laboratory in accordance with Safety, GLP, ISO 9001 standards and SOPs.
2. Ensures premixes and raw materials to be analysed timely to meet the agreed datelines.
3. Analyses the premixes, raw materials, environmental samples and any other related samples in accordance with authorized approved procedures.
4. Conduct bacteriological testing which involves: • Media preparation • Sterility test • Identifying specific species or strains of bacteria • Interpret, calculate, record and compile results. This includes keying in results in LIMS system
5. Ensure good quality of analytical results through scheduling calibration and maintenance of instruments, equipment and sample check program.
6. Maintains proper inventory records and initiates purchases. This includes liaising with suppliers.
7. Assists Senior micro lab tech/Microbiologist in monthly environmental & personnel hygiene monitoring program for the premix plant.
8. Helps to identify and solve problems encountered during his/her daily operations. He/She is required to inform any problems and consult Microbiologist or Senior micro lab tech.
9. Provide guidance and train interns if required.
10. Performs any other duties not defined in this job description when called upon to do so by line management.
SHE Responsibilities
1. Report near miss/first aid cases and accidents to the Lab Supervisor/Manager as soon as possible.
2. Familiarize with the location and proper use of safety facilities such as emergency shower, oxygen detector, fume hood, etc.
3. Bear full responsibilities of wearing appropriate PPE and always observe.
4. Fully understand and assess important information of Safety Data Sheets before commence work.
5. Always follow the safety procedure outlined in the laboratory SHE programs.
6. Enforce SHE practice and supervise interns under own charge
You Bring:
Basic lab skills is mandatory
Minimum Nitec/Diploma in Food Science/Microbiology/ Food Technology etc.
Able to work on Saturday (2 times a month or so) *Applicable for OT payment

Job Title:

- job post
Job Description:
Company overview
Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking), and Investment Management. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com .
Aon’s Benefit Index®, Nomura’s benefits rank #1 amongst our competitors
About the Team:
The Information Technology (IT) division supports the dynamic financial business through the development of a strategic infrastructure for the Nomura offices across the globe. IT partners with the businesses to develop, implement and support sophisticated trading systems and middle, back office systems through the use of state of the art technology and risk management systems. We are developing new applications to implement truly cutting-edge standards and always staying at the forefront of technology and its applications for clients, partners, regulators and suppliers.
Global Markets Technology ( GMIT ) is responsible for developing and managing trading, pricing, analytics, and research systems. These systems are used by trading desks across Credit, Rates, FX, Securitized Products, Prime and Equities groups to process trades. Our software is responsible for providing analytics and trading capabilities needed by our traders and clients in a highly complex and dynamic market. Our team has a strong relationship with the trading business and is committed to helping the firm achieve its business goals. The environment provides an ideal place to learn business processes and determine technology solutions to meet the business needs. Depending on the specific role, members of the team interact with technologists, traders or salespeople on a daily basis.
Risk and Capital Technology (Risk IT) provides risk exposure profiling to the Risk Management business. RCT has a global footprint comprised across London, New York, Mumbai, Hong Kong, and Tokyo. Services and applications include; Market Risk, Credit Risk, and Operational Risk. Additional functions include creating tools to help the Risk business with new product and model validation.
Production Services (WPS and CPS) team maintains software solutions used by the Wholesale Business and Corporate Services globally. The team provides application and systems support across a wide domain including and not limited to Finance, Risk, Equities, Futures & Options, Prime Services including financing, Derivatives, FX, Securitized Products, Operations, Core & Compliance, Infrastructure Tools and Technology Operations and User Helpdesk.
Wholesale Data Services and Operations Technology (WO and WDS IT) supports two major function with Nomura. It provides foundational architectural solutions for market and reference data that powers Nomura’s business. This team is an integral part of Nomura that is responsible for developing and maintaining systems that manage acquisition and distribution of data for the entire organization including front office, middle office, back office, risk, finance and various AI based analytics systems.
It is responsible for supporting trade settlement and transaction processing technology platform. This team provides day-to-day support for the middle office, operations and regulatory users, and manages vendor and in-house applications. WO IT also owns the applications that provide trade settlement data services to other technology teams from Operations, Finance, Risk, Regulatory and Compliance.
Client Services Technology (CST) covers Sales, Investment Banking and Reference Data Services technology applications. The team is responsible for delivering and managing applications across Investment banking division, Sales and provides entity data services globally across Nomura. By building out the client ecosystem, the team improves client services and franchise profitability by improving technology, agility and reducing operational risk.
Enterprise Infrastructure Services (EIS) is responsible for maintaining Nomura’s Core Infrastructure IT platforms globally and ensuring operational stability within the environment. Working in close partnership with the Front Office and Support and Control functions, we create and deliver optimal Infrastructure solutions to support the firm’s international business operations.
Corporate Technology Services (CTS) is responsible for delivering and supporting business applications to; Finance; Compliance; Human Resources; and the rest of the corporate areas. CTS plays an essential role in servicing the Firm’s business needs and future direction by providing the appropriate solutions and capacity whilst also ensuring the ability of the Firm to report, monitor and supervise this business. Our mission is to provide innovative, cost efficient technology solutions to the Firm to underpin competitiveness, revenue generation and regulatory compliance.
IT Risk & Control (ITRC) facilitates the design and monitoring of policies and controls to allow Technology division to operate efficiently and effectively while ensuring technology risk and control requirements from Technology Management, Operational Risk, Internal and External Audit, Regulatory Bodies, Compliance, Legal and Risk controls are met.
Global IT Security (IT Sec) develops the Cybersecurity framework and policies to safeguard Nomura’s data and assets. IT Security has various functional pillars like Cybersecurity Governance and Risk, Security Architecture and Design, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Third Party Risk Management, Cyber Culture and Learning, Security Operations Centre (SOC) and Data Loss Prevention etc. to manage and maintain the cyber posture of the Nomura wholesale globally.
Opportunities:
Opportunity to join us as Technology Analysts based in Singapore or Hong Kong.
The incoming technology analysts will have opportunity to feel our culture, acquire valuable on the job training and expand your network through 2-year programme with 6 month rotation across 4 divisional of technology teams based in Singapore or Hong Kong.
The programme starts with 2 week of global training in July with focus on technology fundamentals such as Cloud, Data Science, Python, Project Management and Building an Enterprise Tech Platform. It will be highly interactive training class which provides our incoming technology analysts with the opportunity for global collaboration through global projects and virtual events via webex.
After you have completed the 2-year programme, you will be assigned to one of technology teams based in Singapore or Hong Kong where you can apply your skills and knowledge to contribute your team’s mission, growing in experience and responsibilty.
Role / Responsitilities:
As a key member the candidate will
Expected to work in small teams to contribute to project deliverables
Identify and help to define the requirements of the projects
Perform coding and unit testing under the direction of team supervisors
Other duties required of you from time to time by your supervisor
Requirements:
Technical:
With 1~2 years’ technology experience, or Master degree / Bachelor degree graduation in 2023
Experienced in programing language like Python, Java, C# etc.
Knowledge of infrastructure e.g. Cloud, Networking, OS and Database etc.
Knowledge of DevOps, Cloud computing, Data analysis / AI tools as plus.
Common:
Excellent Communication Skills
Effective Listening Skills
Collaboration & Leadership Skills
Critical and Analytical Thinking Skills in Decision-Making
Professional Networking & Relationship Development Expertise

Nomura is committed to an employment policy of equal opportunities, and is fundamentally opposed to any less favourable treatment accorded to existing or potential members of staff on the grounds of race, creed, colour, nationality, disability, marital status, pregnancy, gender or sexual orientation.

COMPANY BACKGROUND
Kosmode Health Singapore’s was incorporated with the mission to expand access to health from nature, as a business enabler. Anchored on a Triple Technology Platform, KosmodeHealth overcomes issues of high cost of plant health ingredients for functional food development with proprietary Plant Extraction Technology, and high cost and risk of animal protein biomaterial for biomedical applications with Plant Protein Composite (PPC™) Bio ink formulation technology and proprietary precisioncontrolled 3D bio scaffold printing methodology.
KosmodeHealth has two business verticals:
Plant Extraction & Functional Food vertical serving the Agri-food Industry &
3D Bioprinting vertical serving the 3D cell culture segment in the Biomedical Industry.
The core plant extraction expertise has been utilised to reclaim proteins and fibre from food processing spent materials. A range of protein & fibre functional food prototypes has been developed. Amongst the functional food prototypes developed, is a starchless, high fibre, protein noodles with ZERO Glycemic Index (W0W® Noodles).
Plant protein extracted has also been formulated into Plant Protein Composite (PPC™) bio-ink and that can be printed into 3D PPC™ Scaffold for 3D cells & tissue culture.
Having laid a strong foundation, KosmodeHealth is poised for business outreach and growth. As we expand our business operations, we seek talents who thrives on solving industry problems, is a resourceful, multi-tasker with the resilience and perseverance to drive success in people-centric culture where integrity is the core value and quality a given.
OVERALL JOB SCOPE
The Food Tech Intern supports Technology Lead in plant bioactive extraction, functional food production/formulation/optimization and project management of internal R&D and/or customers’ project.
SPECIFIC ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Undertake extractions of bioactive (e.g. polyphenols, proteins, fibers etc) from botanicals and food processing and/or agri-food side-streams (such as spent barley, spent coffee).
Design, formulate, manufacture functional products for commercialization.
Analysis of food compositions including micronutrients
Support development of ZERO GI functional food with upcycled materials
Project management - Plans, schedules, coordinate internal resources, liaise with third parties/vendors for the seamless execution of customers’ and R&D projects.
Perform analysis, characterization, identification of botanicals, extracts etc.
Develop/design experiments to extend shelf life, optimise production process to achieve technical and marketing specifications
Contribute to efficient end to end (production to order fulfilment) of company’s product portfolio (including but not limited to W0W® Noodles and upcycled ingredients with functional benefits)
Prepare business process reports for management and customers.
Participate in customers’ meetings and business development activities.
QUALIFICATIONS
Academic Qualification:
2nd or 3rd year Food Science & Technology undergraduate
Able to commit for at least 3 months part-time arrangement for month 4, 5 could be explored)
Prior experience in functional food formulation and or marketing are strong advantages.
Skills
Multitasker
Team player, with strong interpersonal & collaborative skills to work in functional matrix team and dynamic environment
Self-driven, resourceful problem solver with a ‘Can-do’ mentality
High sense of curiosity and inquisitiveness
Strong verbal and written communication skills

CDG’s Group Strategy Office is seeking to expand its strategic investment activities across multiple geographic regions and themes within the mobility sector. The Group Strategy team is a small, but highly focused team that looks at the future of mobility & works closely with multiple business units across all 7 countries that CDG has presence in. It functions as a think-tank and facilitator to help CDG identify future mobility trends, devise strategies and kick-start their execution. The Strategy team also manages a US$100 M corporate venture capital fund that strategically invests in early-stage mobility start-ups across the globe.
The Business Analyst will support the Vice President and other members of Group Strategy team. He / She will have the opportunity to be involved in global strategy projects and corporate venture capital (CVC) investments. This is an outstanding opportunity for early career professionals who would like to learn more about strategy as well as venture investing in the high-tech mobility industry and have the chance to build an extensive network with corporates, venture capitalists and start-ups globally.

Responsibilities:
Perform general industry, competitors and macroeconomic research & analysis, follow industry trends & assess new technologies in the mobility sector.
Work with the senior members of the Group Strategy & Investment Team to originate and execute venture capital investments globally.
Regularly conduct market research and analyse market trends to generate investment opportunities & develop an in-house market view.
Prepare financial models, conduct financial analysis as well as due-diligence on investment opportunities.
Generate investment reports and memos to present to senior management for approval.
Attend relevant conferences and events to gather market intelligence & generate a strong deal flow pipeline.
Support the Group’s other strategic and/or corporate development initiatives as required.

Requirements/Qualifications
Bachelors or Masters degree in Business (Finance) or Engineering degree programmes from reputed universities.
2 to 5 years of experience in venture capital investments, corporate strategy teams at reputed MNCs or at management consulting firms.
Possess a good understanding and a strong interest in technology developments related to mobility, logistics, automotive and adjacent sectors (e.g. EV/AV, sharing economy, user experience, IoT, data analytics, artificial intelligence and e-commerce, etc) and the start-up ecosystem.
Prior experience in project and/or business management, in-depth market/ industry research, analysing business models, financial modelling and valuation will be preferred.
Have an entrepreneurial mindset with a strong interest in working with start-up companies as well the ability to think through and solve problems.
Have strong communication skills with the ability to interact, liaise and build strong relationships with all levels of management and entrepreneurs.
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills; other functional skills involving data analytics & visualization (Tableau, Power BI, etc) will be a plus.
Demonstrates resourcefulness, creativity, strong attention to details, commitment to achieve positive business outcomes, ability to multi-task and work independently, a self-starter attitude and respect for co-workers.
Fluency in English required.
Willingness to travel on short notice, if needed.

Company overview
Nomura is a global financial services group with an integrated network spanning over 30 countries and regions. By connecting markets East & West, Nomura services the needs of individuals, institutions, corporates and governments through its three business divisions: Retail, Wholesale (Global Markets and Investment Banking), and Investment Management. Founded in 1925, the firm is built on a tradition of disciplined entrepreneurship, serving clients with creative solutions and considered thought leadership. For further information about Nomura, visit www.nomura.com .

Aon's Benefit Index ® , Nomura's benefits rank #1 amongst our competitors
About the Team:
The Information Technology (IT) division supports the dynamic financial business through the development of a strategic infrastructure for the Nomura offices across the globe. IT partners with the businesses to develop, implement and support sophisticated trading systems and middle, back office systems through the use of state of the art technology and risk management systems. We are developing new applications to implement truly cutting-edge standards and always staying at the forefront of technology and its applications for clients, partners, regulators and suppliers.

Global Markets Technology ( GMIT) is responsible for developing and managing trading, pricing, analytics, and research systems. These systems are used by trading desks across Credit, Rates, FX, Securitized Products, Prime and Equities groups to process trades. Our software is responsible for providing analytics and trading capabilities needed by our traders and clients in a highly complex and dynamic market. Our team has a strong relationship with the trading business and is committed to helping the firm achieve its business goals. The environment provides an ideal place to learn business processes and determine technology solutions to meet the business needs. Depending on the specific role, members of the team interact with technologists, traders or salespeople on a daily basis.
Risk and Capital Technology (Risk IT) provides risk exposure profiling to the Risk Management business. RCT has a global footprint comprised across London, New York, Mumbai, Hong Kong, and Tokyo. Services and applications include; Market Risk, Credit Risk, and Operational Risk. Additional functions include creating tools to help the Risk business with new product and model validation.
Production Services (WPS and CPS) team maintains software solutions used by the Wholesale Business and Corporate Services globally. The team provides application and systems support across a wide domain including and not limited to Finance, Risk, Equities, Futures & Options, Prime Services including financing, Derivatives, FX, Securitized Products, Operations, Core & Compliance, Infrastructure Tools and Technology Operations and User Helpdesk.
Wholesale Data Services and Operations Technology (WO and WDS IT) supports two major function with Nomura. It provides foundational architectural solutions for market and reference data that powers Nomura's business. This team is an integral part of Nomura that is responsible for developing and maintaining systems that manage acquisition and distribution of data for the entire organization including front office, middle office, back office, risk, finance and various AI based analytics systems.
It is responsible for supporting trade settlement and transaction processing technology platform. This team provides day-to-day support for the middle office, operations and regulatory users, and manages vendor and in-house applications. WO IT also owns the applications that provide trade settlement data services to other technology teams from Operations, Finance, Risk, Regulatory and Compliance.
Client Services Technology (CST) covers Sales, Investment Banking and Reference Data Services technology applications. The team is responsible for delivering and managing applications across Investment banking division, Sales and provides entity data services globally across Nomura. By building out the client ecosystem, the team improves client services and franchise profitability by improving technology, agility and reducing operational risk.
Enterprise Infrastructure Services (EIS) is responsible for maintaining Nomura's Core Infrastructure IT platforms globally and ensuring operational stability within the environment. Working in close partnership with the Front Office and Support and Control functions, we create and deliver optimal Infrastructure solutions to support the firm's international business operations.
Corporate Technology Services (CTS) is responsible for delivering and supporting business applications to; Finance; Compliance; Human Resources; and the rest of the corporate areas. CTS plays an essential role in servicing the Firm's business needs and future direction by providing the appropriate solutions and capacity whilst also ensuring the ability of the Firm to report, monitor and supervise this business. Our mission is to provide innovative, cost efficient technology solutions to the Firm to underpin competitiveness, revenue generation and regulatory compliance.
IT Risk & Control (ITRC) facilitates the design and monitoring of policies and controls to allow Technology division to operate efficiently and effectively while ensuring technology risk and control requirements from Technology Management, Operational Risk, Internal and External Audit, Regulatory Bodies, Compliance, Legal and Risk controls are met.
Global IT Security (IT Sec) develops the Cybersecurity framework and policies to safeguard Nomura's data and assets. IT Security has various functional pillars like Cybersecurity Governance and Risk, Security Architecture and Design, Cyber Threat Intelligence, Third Party Risk Management, Cyber Culture and Learning, Security Operations Centre (SOC) and Data Loss Prevention etc. to manage and maintain the cyber posture of the Nomura wholesale globally.

Opportunities :
Opportunity to join us as Technology Analysts based in Singapore or Hong Kong.
The incoming technology analysts will have opportunity to feel our culture, acquire valuable on the job training and expand your network through 2-year programme with 6 month rotation across 4 divisional of technology teams based in Singapore or Hong Kong.
The programme starts with 2 week of global training in July with focus on technology fundamentals such as Cloud, Data Science, Python, Project Management and Building an Enterprise Tech Platform. It will be highly interactive training class which provides our incoming technology analysts with the opportunity for global collaboration through global projects and virtual events via webex.
After you have completed the 2-year programme, you will be assigned to one of technology teams based in Singapore or Hong Kong where you can apply your skills and knowledge to contribute your team's mission, growing in experience and responsibilty.

Job Title:
Head of Program Management
- job post
Job Description:
We’re hiring a Head of Program Management
We are hiring an experienced and talented Head of Program Management to lead and grow a globally distributed team of 25+ program managers. You’ll ensure the alignment of workflows and best practices, and guide the team’s overall learning and development as they plan and manage the timely delivery of work across various cross-functional teams. In this pivotal role you will connect and collaborate with leaders across the organization, and around the world.
Our program managers are proactive, motivated, and uber-organized. They’re in high demand on projects in a broad variety of departments—from Engineering, to Marketing, to Corporate functions, where they help grow the complexity and scale of projects we can deliver.
In this role, you will partner with stakeholders across the business to increase the effectiveness of the program management function. Your team enables the successful delivery of all kinds of work, from our most complex strategic initiatives to daily business-as-usual. The teammates you’ll lead are fun, highly productive, and have a continuous learning mindset. The Program Management team is well anchored and recognized across the organization as a key business support function that is instrumental in both our growth and our drive towards operational excellence.
What you’ll be doing
The program management function is responsible for :
Partnering across the division to ensure the efficient delivery of work for teams by effectively managing projects and processes, and providing strategic input on delivery
Building, communicating, and maintaining: standards, best practices, processes, training, resources, methodologies, tools, and techniques
Efficient prioritization, planning, and delivery of teams’ work
The function’s success metrics :
Capacity to serve teams across the business with program managers
Improved cross-functional collaboration and dependency management (for teams with program managers)
Ensuring standard tools and processes for managing work/tasks/projects are well understood and adopted org-wide
Efficiency of delivery and accomplishment of team’s OKRs
As head of the function, you will:
People-manage the program management function (currently that’s 25 full-time employees), including:
Assign responsibilities, coach, train, motivate, and hold the team accountable for delivering your expected results
Design the organizational structure for your team and adapt as needed for the future
Manage ~3 managers (direct reports), and possibly senior individual contributors
Ensure your direct reports have the tools to manage their reports. You define expectations, guide career and skill growth, and hold people accountable.
Execute and optimize the hiring plan. Partner with our recruiting team to build your team with exceptional people in Hong Kong, Singapore, Romania, and other locations worldwide.
Understand the relative business priorities and balance this with the needs of individuals to manage the placement of program managers across the organization.
Design, implement, and deliver standards and best practices in project/program management company-wide
Raise project/program-management related skills across the organization
3 best things about this role:
The awesome team - keen to grow, learn and contribute. You’ll enjoy coming to work with this bunch every day.
The support plus autonomy - you’re empowered to really take ownership of your area but can count on senior leadership support as needed.
The variety of interesting projects - the work program management delivers is super varied spanning tech, marketing, and corporate - there’s always something new to learn!
What you’ll need to succeed
10+ years of experience in project/program management or equivalent. You’ve worked on complex cross-functional projects at a variety of scales, ideally some of these in software development, an agile environment, etc.
5+ years of experience leading people. Must have experience hiring, managing performance and compensation, and creating skill development plans for your direct reports.
A talent for leading people. You set clear expectations. You lead by example, inspire, coach, mentor, and teach as necessary, and hold people accountable to delivering as expected.
You’re great at leading people across several disciplines, backgrounds, and cultures towards a singular goal or vision.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills, with strong command of the English language.
You are confident but willing to learn. You give and receive constructive criticism well.
You’ve got experience managing remote teams and managers, finding a way to create an inclusive team culture despite geographical distance.
Based in Singapore, and willing to travel occasionally to other offices.
A passion for nurturing talent, supporting and growing people, and helping them find the most suitable role within our organization.
Ability to still get your hands dirty when needed to dig into projects and provide support and coordination to get tough problems solved.
Nice skills to have, but not required
Comfortable communicating with developers on technical topics
Several years of experience managing people-managers, as some or all of your direct reports will be managers
Expert proficiency in Jira

Who You Are

As an Operations Associate, you will be one of the key people responsible for Coins.ph’s operations that are responsible for customer liquidity and digital currency trading.
In your role, you will have oversight over our day to day exchange operations as well as trading activities, working with our engineers and technology partners to ensure the best possible experience for our customers and exchange liquidity is optimized.
You will be responsible for managing as well as proposing a variety of solutions to maximize our user value and business in the company's day-to-day operations. The results from your efforts will directly impact both the security as well as the bottom line of the company.
You should be comfortable with handling and thinking strategically about complex and interconnected systems, leveraging your background in cryptocurrency technologies and trading knowledge to make decisions that optimize many often competing priorities.You have a knack for moving quickly while still paying attention to details.
You should be able to leverage data analytics to drive key strategic decisions and rapidly iterate on ideas alongside other members of our trading, finance, and engineering teams.

What you'll do
Oversight and management of Coins’ crypto trading platform
Support trading as well as manage our firm’s digital currency exposures and liquidity across multiple exchanges, countries, and currencies
Working closely with Coins’ engineering team, business partners, and service providers to drive enhancement of Coins’ trading systems
Perform day-to-day calculation and analysis of back-end configuration to support token and trading pair management
Leverage trading metrics to identify inefficiencies and opportunities to increase profitability and performance
What we expect from you
2+ years of experience working in the crypto/ finance/ tech
Excellent analytical, mathematical, and financial skills, with strong attention to detail
You’re biased toward action, are a great collaborator, and can distill complex plans into clear and actionable tasks
Ability to excel in a fast-paced, highly analytical environment where multi-tasking and short timelines are met with consistent ability to achieve results
Able to perform under pressure when requiredYou’re able to roll up your sleeves and do whatever it takes to get the task at hand done
You have a true passion for Coins.ph ’s mission for financial inclusion across Southeast Asia

Job Title:
2023 Summer Internship - Tech For Good Institute (May - Aug)
- job post
Job Description:
Job Description:
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.
Get to know the Team
The Tech for Good Institute (TFGI) is an independent non-profit think tank on a mission to nurture the positive impact of technology, to harness its full potential to uplift lives in Southeast Asia. It is founded by Grab, Southeast Asia’s leading superapp.

The Institute seeks to create dialogue to foster common ground on the impact of technology on society and policy. It supports action-based, insights-oriented research that demonstrates how technology addresses social concerns. It also serves as a platform to enhance capabilities that facilitate the understanding of technology’s impact in Southeast Asia.

We believe that critical conversations and meaningful exchanges of ideas on how to harness technology’s full potential will be key in steering Southeast Asia towards a positive transformation. Read more about TFGI at www.techforgoodinstitute.org
The Day-to-Day Activities:
(1) Support strategy implementation for TFGI:
Work with TFGI’s executive team to support the set up of the Institute and its programmes
Support on strategy development for initiatives, including conversations, dialogues and research programmes
Coordinate and work with other teams to ensure smooth delivery of workplan
(2) Support TFGI’s engagement efforts:
Work with team members to develop and execute initiatives that drive engagement with public and private sectors in key Southeast Asia markets, e.g. planning and production of dialogues, content creation for online publication
Support research and landscape analysis on social and economic issues accelerated by tech-enabled business models in Southeast Asia
Develop materials and platforms for amplification of TFGI’s content, e.g. write copy and design of visual assets for TFGI’s social media and monthly digest newsletter
Support the development of partnerships with government, community and private stakeholders in support of TFGI’s mission:
Coordinate between external partners and internal teams to execute on partnership initiatives
The Must-Haves:
Knowledge of and/or interest in on social and economic issues accelerated by tech-enabled business models in Southeast Asia
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
Experience and comfort with online design tools such as Canva
Must have a strong self-starter and proactive attitude, with the ability to work through constraints and deliver high-quality results
Must be comfortable working under pressure and can execute in a fast-paced environment
Strong planning and project management skills
Passionate about making a positive impact in Southeast Asia
Our Commitment
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

About The Role

The demand for big data professionals has never been higher. If you’re a graduate with a strong interest in data, finding patterns in data, and are drawn to programming this could be your opportunity to embark on an exciting future as a Data Engineer.

You’ll receive industry relevant training in diverse languages including SQL, Hive QL, Python and Spark. You will also learn how to process massive amounts of data, create data flows, manage data lakes, design real time streaming and batch type data ingestion pipelines. You will be involved in exciting projects, managing and processing huge datasets, and become an expert in distributed data storage and computing frameworks.

A chance to launch a career in one of the most in-demand tech fields
