Job Title:
Head of Global Procurement
- job post
Job Description:
Fuelling the business of fun.
Not just a game-changer, it’s a life-changer. Designed to deliver a superior guest experience, the software solutions platform is a complete integrated solution made to enable business owners to achieve greater operational efficiency while reducing costs and increasing profitability.
With Embed’s platform, a business (single or multi-location) has real-time visibility and control across the entire operation: a full range of games management, real-time prize inventory, from guest party planning and bookings via mobile to integrated point-of-sales, including bundles and upsell packages, self-recycling game card kiosks and so much more. And it is all interconnected.
We have offices across the globe: USA, EMEA, and Asia. With more than 1,000 customers and over 3,000 installations in 56 countries, we are equipped and ready to empower Family Entertainment businesses with direct sales, services, and support anytime, anywhere.
We are in the business of fun and no one takes fun more seriously than us, which is why we put our people at the heart of everything we do, and how we do it. Get inspired because no one’s having more fun than us.
POSITION SUMMARY
We offer you an exciting position in a successful, international, and fast-growing organization. You will be part of a fresh and motivated team and you will have plenty of room for self-development with enough prospects for professional growth.
The purpose of this role is to drive the strategic priorities and value driven procurement activities in all aspects of procurement across our global business. The position will be based in Singapore and will report to the CEO Solutions Group. This role requires an experienced procurement professional who has led teams to develop outsource partners and suppliers to meet the business objectives.
In this position, you will be responsible for Embeds global sourcing efforts, and you will work closely with our regional teams in North America, APAC and EMEA to lead centralized direct and indirect sourcing and procurement efforts. You will be responsible for the management of key suppliers around the world (with a focus on China, US, Taiwan, India and a strategy to diversify).
You have a vast experience in sourcing within technology companies. You are entrepreneurial, convincing and seek cooperation with others to achieve optimal results. You are hands-on and pro-active. You will be based in Singapore and frequent traveling will also be part of your job.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Key Deliverables:
Lead relevant procurement activities, from initiation to implementation and ongoing contract management to achieve successful commercial outcomes
Collaborating with the Global Leadership Team in developing and implementing strategic initiatives
Collaborating with internal stakeholders, including finance, technology teams, and Sales to set ambitious goals that help move the organization forward so there is a greater emphasis on strategic procurement, as opposed to tactical procurement
Have a keen insight and understanding of program requirements on a 1-3-5 year horizon.
Develop annual cost-out savings programs and implement business strategies that directly affect the company financial results and growth plans
Monitors and ensures the efficient operation of the company and the team in the procurement of material, equipment and services
Develop, implement and maintain procurement policy and procedures, which will include delivering procurement training to the organisation
Design and implement a procurement reporting framework for management review of procurement activities, spend and benefits realisation
Establishing mechanisms to evaluate your team’s performance, and mentoring them for overall performance and effectiveness in specific situations.
Intervene to address supply chain failures as necessary
Advocating the value of procurement by aligning with internal customers and ensuring that their requirements are met
Manage P2P workflow process related to PR/PO cycle-time
Serve as ERP system focal point for functionality as relates to purchasing function
Scope of this role includes establishing global processes related to the procure to pay function.
Management and refinement of standardised naming conventions and inventory management process on the company’s ERP platform
Creating demand forecasts based on sales data and industry trends in order to predict future demand for products or services
Monitoring inventory levels to ensure that there is enough supply to meet demand
Supplier Management and Market Knowledge
Personally and proactively manage all aspects of implementation including entry and exit of suppliers and ensuring effective change management
Ensure that every supplier relationship is set up for future continuous improvement of cost down and lead the measurement and review process that ensures delivery of ongoing improvement
Identifying new suppliers or potential suppliers who could meet organization’s needs
Reviewing bids from suppliers to ensure that they comply with specified requirements
Providing guidance to suppliers regarding company policies and procedures
Develop Supplier Development programs and continuous improvement to achieve improve lead time, better quality and speed to deliver to meet our customers’ request date
Identify suppliers for growth, maintain and exit strategy
Identifying suppliers that require development and improvement with plans and clear deliverables
Contractual Documents
Negotiation of price, credit and other commercial terms with contract manufactures and major suppliers to the business
Commercial Negotiations and Sourcing Arrangements
Review, design and implement annual strategic purchasing plans
Assure supply by developing supplier relationships and establish agreements with global suppliers.
Negotiating prices with suppliers on behalf of the company to ensure that costs are kept low while maintaining high quality standards
Lead advanced data analytics, cost modelling, and TCO analysis in support of sourcing and negotiating strategies
Lead sourcing including RFX, RFP, negotiations and contracting to put in place the right suppliers
Ensuring that strategy, processes, and tools are in place and that they are continuously optimized to source at the best possible conditions
Manage freight suppliers to minimize cost and maximize on-time delivery metrics
Identify metrics, tools and processes to optimize sourcing
REQUIRED SKILL AND EXPERIENCED
At least 10 year(s) of working experience in the related field as a manager
People manager with at least 5+ of those years spent managing procurement personnel
Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads
Demonstrated understanding of contracts and experience negotiating complex agreements with suppliers of critical importance to the business
Demonstrated interest and success in developing others' careers
Proven experience leading cost savings initiatives and communicating cost savings achievements
Proven history of autonomously managed travel, ability to work in challenging conditions
Past achievements of leading change management and transformation
Experience working in a matrix organization preferred
Excellent problem solving and root cause analysis skills
Work in a way that positively engages the support of stakeholders using problem solving and proactive communication skills.
The complexity of categories and projects require high quality project and program management skills and a proven ability to manage change both internally and externally
Must be able to effectively communicate with senior leadership and across cultural/geographical boundaries.
Prior experience with ERP, Netsuite preferred
Ability to travel within China, The Middle East, USA and Asia Pacific.
Be able to work flexible hours due to the majority of clients based internationally. Some work out of normal work hours may be expected
WHAT WE OFFER:
Exposure to the vibrant and fast-pace world of high-tech company.
Working with passionate, smart, and driven colleagues in a supportive environment.
Group Medical Insurance (Group Term Life, Group Hospital & Surgical, Group Outpatient Clinical, Group Outpatient Specialist, Group Dental)
Paid time off to include vacation, sick, annual leave and Singapore statutory leave
Robust Learning Management System for employee growth and development

Are you a Programmer who loves to teach?
Or..
Are you a Teacher who loves to code?

Description
Computhink is a Programming School for Kids. We provide beginner to advanced level weekly coding classes and holiday camps for students from the ages of 7 to 16.
Our structured weekly curriculum covers 300+ topics on Computational Thinking, Programming Concepts, Techniques, Syntax, and Algorithms. Students will learn to program with Scratch, Minecraft Education Edition, CodeStudio, Python, HTML, CSS, Javascript and more!
We believe that the ability to understand and write computer programs is an essential skill in an increasingly connected and digital world. Anyone can learn to program, and we aim to make it so.

Position Summary
We seek qualified candidates to join our teaching team. This is a permanent/ contract full-time position. Part-Time teaching positions are also available for suitable candidates
The ideal candidate keeps themselves updated on new technology, and is energetic and self-motivated to try new things. You are motivated, independent and a self-starter who loves being a role model for young kids age 7 to 16.
You will build your technical skill set, explore new coding libraries and frameworks, write new curriculum content, and keep your technical skills current.
Responsibilities
Research and develop new class curriculum, content and exercises for students. Review and improve on current content/ curriculum.
Manage, maintain and develop in-house systems such as the e-Learning Portal, Sharepoint, Vimeo, Student Management System, Team Password Managers and others.
Manage Parent-Teacher relationships and provide a wholesome learning environment for students.
Lead and conceptualise projects to engage and educate the public on why programming classes is relevant for their children.
Assist in Business Development and lead the conceptualisation, brainstorming and execution of internal and external events such as Coding Hackathons
Teach Programming and Programming Concepts in small group classes for kids aged 7 to 16.
Qualifications
Diploma or Degree in an Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or Science related field.
Good programming background with a positive learning attitude.
Experience with working with young children will be a plus.
Qualities we are looking out for
You are a sharp thinker, can analyse problems well, and have the confidence to learn and try new things.
You have a pleasant, positive and optimistic personality. You believe in doing things well in a personal and professional capacity.
You are independent and work well in a small team setting or individually.
You set a high standard for yourself and like to think of ways to improve things.
Why you should join us
You are energetic and spirited and do not want to work in a mundane 9-to-6 job in a corporation.
You want to contribute your skills in a meaningful way and take control of your time.
You have an entrepreneurial mindset and believe you can make a difference in your community.
Working Hours
5- Day Work Week (4 weekdays and 1 weekend)
Flexible Working or Work-from-Home options can be arranged as long as it does not conflict with teaching schedules.
Staff Rewards
Code Sponsor – Sponsor up to 2 students to attend classes for free
Staff discounts off class fees (for friends and families)
Tech and Gym Allowances
Workout Mornings and Flexi-Mornings
Holiday Time Offs (during year-end and other holidays)
Send us an email with an updated resume to hr@computhink.com.sg
Why Computhink?

Maximum learning in small classes
All our classes are kept small to ensure maximum attention to your child's learning needs. By keeping the class small, we ensure that each kid gets the guidance and coaching he or she needs to bring their imagination to life through programming. Besides allowing us to get to know your kid better, we also encourage the kids in our classes to get to know one another and this is better facilitated in a small group setting.

Hands-On Activity-Based Learning
We believe that kids learn best when they do it themselves in a fun environment. That is why we ensure that each kid is given a laptop to work their own respective projects and try their hand in the programming projects and activities. It is heartening each time we see the kids beaming and being proud of themselves when they get the code to work as they want it to.

Our Teaching Philosophy
This idea that kids will learn anything that they want to, when they are given the freedom to create, inspires and drives our teaching philosophy. In this, we are influenced by the work of Sugata Mitra (Educational Researcher) whose research demonstrates the effect that a child’s innate curiosity and interest have on learning complex subjects outside the normal school environment.

Follow-On Mastery Classes
Join our regular weekly semester classes and let your child enhance their understanding and develop deep technical and programming skills. We provide classes from CodeThinker Levels 1 to Level 10. Each level is equivalent to one year of study. Students will learn Programming skills through ScratchThinker, PythonThinker, CodeStudio, HTML+CSS, Javascript and more!
Our curriculum is constantly being updated by professionals to reflect the latest in the IT industry. Want to learn AI? We've got it! Develop a game of mobile app? We've got you covered!

We are seeking a Chief Technology Officer (CTO) who will work with us to create this innovative, cutting edge software platform that will deliver much value to customers.

Discover and implement new technologies that yield competitive advantage

You’ve managed, mentored, and inspired a small team of engineers providing architectural guidance, code reviews, etc.

Experience in project management to ensure timely deliverables
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to share/collaborate with peers
Experience with a digital platform or Software-as-a-Service product in the food and beverage industry is necessary

Who we are and what we do
Deel is a global team that helps businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily. Deel consists of more than two thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 100 countries. Our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the Deel platform and our products for customers.
Companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. Programming & Technology|others|Full-time

Job description

At HoYoverse, we are committed to creating immersive virtual world experiences for players around the world. In addition to game products such as Genshin Impact, Honkai Impact 3rd, Tears of Themis, and Honkai: Star Rail, HoYoverse also launched the dynamic desktop software N0va Desktop, the community product HoYoLAB, and created a variety of products such as animations, comics, music, novels, and merchandise around our original creative concept.

Adhering to our mission of Tech Otakus Save the World, we have always been committed to technology research and development, exploring cutting-edge technologies, and have accumulated leading technical capabilities in cartoon rendering, artificial intelligence, cloud gaming technology, and other fields.

HoYoverse is actively engaged in globalization, with offices in Singapore, Montreal, Los Angeles, Tokyo, Seoul, and other areas.

Job Description

High quality animations play a critical role in all HoYoverse games .We are searching for a candidate who is passionate about applying cutting-edge technologies into game animation production. As a computer graphics researcher, you will be working with our talented artists and other engineering team members, creating innovative tools and pipelines to unleash artists’ creativity, empower them to make stunning animations that used in the company’s major game titles.

What You Will Do:
Conduct research in e.g. human body modeling/geometry processing/motion generation
Understand in-house mocap/general animation process to establish requirements from animators
Design, implement and maintain animation systems and tools with the other engineering team members
In-depth research with state of the art technologies and apply in a pragmatic way
Write clear, maintainable, and efficient code
Build good document for both engineers and artists

What We Are Looking for:
Solid understanding/experience in computer graphics
Good understanding in geometry processing, deformation, computer animation
Have interest in computer animation related technologies such as mocap, motion editing, motion synthesis, etc
Have good understanding in recent animation related research in academia or industry
Willing to do early algorithm exploration on challenging technical topics
Willing to work in a multidisciplinary team, especially collaborate closely with animators
Excellent programming ability and strong bias for implementation and deployment
Excellent communication skills and teamwork ability
Big plus if have mocap/animation experience

Benefits:
Competitive salary
100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you and your dependents
Generous paid time off
401K/ RRSP plan
Employer-paid life and disability insurance
Team-building activities throughout the year
Flexible working hours

Do We Support Flexible Work?

Yes, as a remote team across North American time zones, we embrace flexible working. You may choose to work remotely, in-offices or hybrid, for a more flexible lifestyle that suits you best. Our offices are located in downtown Montreal and downtown Santa Monica, surrounded by great restaurants, entertainment, and cultural venues.

We are an equal opportunity employer that believes diverse backgrounds are key to bringing our concepts to life. If you’re looking to play a key role in creating the best immersive virtual world experience for our users, we invite you to join our team.

Job Description:
About Accenture
Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations services and Accenture Song—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. We Are
As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, we're helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. It's a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for innovative pioneers to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term.
We're a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world.

The Work

Supporting in defining, creating, and documenting our Consumer Metaverse offering by leveraging your extensive industry, technology, and use case expertise

Participating in education and demonstrating technical training activities to colleagues and clients how the Consumer Metaverse offering, and its building blocks could be used to deliver value at scale, and in short time
What’s In It For You?
By joining our team, you'll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways.

1+ years’ demonstrated experience understanding, assessing, and analyzing industry or business challenges, identifying new opportunities, and explaining how an offering and service provides value with an objective and independent point of view

Self-driven individual with high level of attention to details, and inquisitive/can-do attitude to new territories
Familiarity and/or high-level understanding of different technologies serving consumer experiences on the Metaverse (e.g., Cloud Rendering, e-Commerce platforms, volumetric capture, etc.)

Job Title:
Associate Strategic Negotiator, Data Center Site Acquisition
- job post
Job Description:
Google will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require Google's sponsorship of a visa.
Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Business Management, Public Policy, Finance, Real Estate, Technology, Engineering, or equivalent practical experience.
4 years of experience in collocation agreements, site selection for industrial-scale projects, real estate evaluation, acquisition, development, construction, utility agreements negotiation, implementing clean energy initiatives, or financial modeling.
Experience managing projects and timelines within the Asia Pacific region.

Preferred qualifications:
Experience in economic development policy, financial modeling, infrastructure development, agreement drafting/redlining, and presentation development.
Experience in power transmission and distribution, telecommunications infrastructure, data center technology, electrical and cooling technology.
Experience with real estate markets within Asia Pacific region and establishing infrastructure in markets.
Ability to provide commercial and technical solutions.
About the job
Google's infrastructure needs go far beyond server computers. As Google's products and services scale the globe, the Strategic Negotiation team works behind the scenes to secure infrastructure for Google's future - everything from underwater cables to physical data center space. As a Strategic Negotiator, you combine your deep market knowledge of a given sector with tech industry savvy to negotiate cost-effective solutions to support Google's infrastructure growth. You'll work with specific project teams on negotiating deals, managing vendor and partner relationships and presenting deal recommendations to our Tech leadership. Your successful negotiations have the potential to save Google millions of dollars in operating costs and impact every part of the business.
In this role, you will work within Google Energy and Location Strategy team. You will help to drive location strategy, site selection, and portfolio management for new and existing data centers sites and related infrastructure. You will support the development of the company's global energy portfolio strategy (e.g., identifying and helping in the creation of industry leading renewable energy projects), to support the company’s goal to be carbon neutral.
Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.
Responsibilities
Work with internal and external Technical teams to identify, define, and pursue site selection projects and initiatives necessary to meet Google ongoing data center needs.
Lead data center site evaluations and selection process from end-to-end, monitor progress against objectives, provide regular status reports, and financial metrics to support portfolio decisions.
Lead the acquisition of appropriate data centers and develop strategic agreements with vendors, landowners, and key suppliers for space and utility services.
Manage the strategy for ongoing growth at existing sites and develop metrics for the mapping and tracking of portfolio management issues regarding site/infrastructure development.
Develop inclusive workplace for colleagues in day-to-day interactions and conversations.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

Job Title:
Director of Real Estate and Asset Management, APAC
- job post
Job Description:
JR: 359344
Job Purpose
GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to impact the health of 2.5 billion people around the world in the next 10 years. In Workplace Real Estate & Facilities (WREF) our unique contribution will accelerate GSK’s success by transforming the employee experience, inspiring everyone to be their best wherever they work.
WREF incorporates the Global Real Estate team that is responsible for all any property related transactions that impact the GSK real estate portfolio consisting of complex R&D facilities, office buildings, manufacturing plants and distribution centres. The sites may be owned, leased or be occupied through a serviced space arrangement. WREF works in close collaboration with our Global Function partners (Finance, Tech, HR, EHS, Legal, Procurement etc) and relies extensively on our network of vendor partners to deliver a safe, productive and highly desirable work environment for all users of our sites.
The Director of Real Estate and Asset Management, APAC leads a small team of GSK professional real estate advisers plus highly skilled external consultants to optimise the performance of the Region’s property portfolio (currently comprising c. 6.7m Sqft, across more than 115 properties in 16 countries, and with an annual operating cost of c.£160m).

Primary responsibilities
Leading the formulation of the Regional Real Estate strategy
Taking commercial accountability for the short, medium and long term financial performance of the real estate asset classes that comprise the APAC portfolio
Working with real estate experts and advisors across the Region to develop highly creative and innovative real estate solutions that fully leverage GSK’s property assets, driving higher returns, creating added value, lowering GSK’s cost base, and creating vibrant new workplaces that drive higher employee productivity and workplace experience.
Co-ordinating large, complex transactions from concept to completion, including the preparation of submissions for Executive approval of real estate transactions to support the Group’s overall business plans, including acquisitions, divestments, lease renewals, rent reviews and local tax appeals.
Leading the development and delivery of significant projects to optimise business performance and ensure the optimum utilisation of facilities ensuring cost efficiency, effectiveness and sustainability
Working with peers in Finance to support the preparation of regular financial reviews of the Regional property portfolios
Supporting the development of GSK’s culture through the ongoing development of physical workspace environments to ensure that GSK maintains its position as a Modern Employer of choice.
Why you?

We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Bachelor Degree qualification
Holding a Professional Qualification/Accreditation in real estate such as Membership of the Royal Institute of Chartered Surveyors or Corenet
Minimum 3 years of experience in real estate transaction in at least 3 different APAC countries
Strong subject matter expertise in a particular Real Estate Asset Class, eg manufacturing plants/office space
Proven capabilities and knowledge of property development and the built environment
Ability to work with and to influence senior levels of management
Ability to think strategically, anticipating the impact of external environmental changes on Real Estate approaches and to translate the impact into operational plans that proactively respond to and manage the changes to the benefit of the organisation
Ability to effectively communicate with and influence external and internal parties
Ability to build strong working relationships with internal partners and external bodies
Proven leadership capability to inspire and generate a sense of team spirit
Experience ideally gained in a highly regulated R&D or manufacturing environment, experience in a large corporate real estate team also advantageous
Good judgement based on proven analytical and complex problem solving skills
Highly organised and able to plan, prioritise and manage multiple activities effectively
Ability to identify, evaluate, resolve and manage outcomes of project risks (through project specialists and/or stakeholders)
Recognition of other cultures, points of view and stakeholders’ needs
Good communication, presentation and leadership skills.
Ability not only to identify challenges but to create solutions and options
Ability to deal with ambiguity and complexity and skilled at simplifying complex and specialist information
Why GSK?

LI-GSK
GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organisation where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to impact the health of 2.5 billion people around the world in the next 10 years.
Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a workplace where everyone can feel a sense of belonging and thrive as set out in our Equal and Inclusive Treatment of Employees policy. We’re committed to being more proactive at all levels so that our workforce reflects the communities we work and hire in, and our GSK leadership reflects our GSK workforce.

Job Title:

Job Description:
Why Deliveroo?
We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We are providing people with limitless access to different cuisines and restaurants, turning cooking from a chore to a choice, and giving people the freedom to eat what they want, when they want, where they want it.
We work with riders, restaurants and consumers. We operate one of the most complex three-sided marketplaces in the world and we do this in real-time. Millions of customers and thousands of restaurants and riders rely on us to match them within milliseconds. The algorithms behind that marketplace are the secret sauce that allows us to deliver our orders in around 30 minutes.
We're a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride.

The Team
Deliveroo's Commercial Team manages the partnership with our Restaurant and Grocery partners. Using data-driven insights and our Deliveroo-created tools, we help our partners increase their revenue and improve their operations on our platform. We are a group of dynamic team players who work hard together to achieve a common goal, but ensure that we have fun doing it. If you love the food scene and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic workplace, this is the place for you!

The Role
The Commercial Intern will report directly to the country Business Operations & Strategy lead. The role will focus on supporting data analytics initiatives from local priorities and also from our central global team. The nature of the initiatives and projects is to drive performance for our restaurant partners through our commercial organization. The objective of the Business Operation & Strategy function is to deliver strategic actionable insights to achieve our company goals and objectives.

Responsibilities:
Collecting, compiling, organizing and analyzing data on restaurants and consumers to help drive data-driven decisions.

Working with cross-functional departments on requirements gathering, and coordinating efforts within the Commercial Leadership teams to drive business growth (Account Management, Restaurant Operations, Marketing, Operations, Customer Service, Corporate).

Ad-hoc tasks relevant to the Commercial team's requirements

Experience with data dashboards and/or data visualisation tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau) is a plus.
Excellent attention to detail, people skills and organisation skills.
An interest in food is great here. It's a place to unleash the foodie in you.
You must be a self-starter as we'll look for you to manage your own time and priorities here.
Able to commit for 6 months preferred.

After this internship, you will
Have increased your analytical ability and communication skills with relevant industry experience in the tech and data analytics field;
Have gained knowledge about the importance of data-driven insights in a highly competitive, fast-paced, and cutting edge business;
Have gained a deep understanding of the dynamics of the Food and Delivery Industry in Singapore / APAC
Know what it entails to work in a fast-paced scale-up environment with a dynamic international team with varying backgrounds and experiences.

About NextBillion.ai

NextBillion.ai is a first-ever decentralised, customizable, and tailored map stack focused on the transportation/logistics industry.

NextBillion.ai helps solve highly complex transportation and operational challenges. Every customer, use case, geography is different, and NextBillion.ai is able to integrate these differences directly into their mapping environment.

NextBillion.ai provides last-mile delivery, telematics, food delivery, automotive, and ride-hail with location tools and API's that help them adopt an AI-first approach. NextBillion.ai is customizable to be hyper-local and pinpoint accurate for difficult to solve enterprise use cases.

Nextbillion.ai was founded in January 2020 by Ajay Bulusu, Chief Product Officer Gaurav Bubna and CTO Shaolin Zheng. They were formerly part of the map team at Grab, a multinational ride-hailing and food delivery company. The startup is headquartered in Singapore and currently has 55 employees spread across Hyderabad, Bengaluru, India and Singapore. NextBillion.ai has raised a total of $7m in funding backed by Falcon Edge Capital, Lightspeed India Partners and several private investors

Job Title:
Assistant Manager / Manager (Infocomm Policy)
- job post
Job Description:
What the role is
The Digital domain is a key driver of economic growth for Singapore and is today a dominant reality for Singaporeans. However, along with the economic promise and ubiquity of digitalisation comes domestic and global challenges. One aspect is in the regulatory space, to ensure that our regulatory policies in both traditional telecom / internet and in the expanded scope of digital connectivity remain relevant, and constantly watch for tech trends and societal shifts in both domestic and international front, to formulate fit for purpose regulatory policies for the growth of our digital economy.

The candidate will be part of a team that will help identify opportunities, incubate ideas and develop policies for the digital domain (ranging from telecom, internet and new digital connectivity and regulatory issues), and put forth forward thinking policies and regulations in digital technology and services to advance growth of SG’s digital economy.
What you will be working on
Undertake research, perform robust and deep analysis, and engage internal and external stakeholders, to establish sound policy positions (including legal and regulatory policy).
Monitor the infocomm and digital economy environment in order to develop, recommend and implement short and long-term policies and regulatory frameworks, and propose the regulatory and strategic moves that IMDA should make or advocate in response.
Present, advocate and demonstrate the validity of policies for implementation.
Manage and ensure progress of the various work streams.
Play an advisory role to other business units within IMDA regarding existing policy positions and new areas of policy work in the infocomm and digital economy space
Participate and contribute to international platforms to advance Singapore's interests
What we are looking for
Background in Economics, Engineering, or Law. Other disciplines might be considered.
Keen and demonstrated interest and understanding of technology, the digital economy and telecom / internet sector and its impact on economy and society – in areas such as technology developments, business and consumer concerns, social-economic environment in Singapore, international legal/regulatory developments, public policy
Clear and good writing, with an analytical mind and the ability to communicate broad policy/regulatory ideas and granular details with clarity, brevity and coherence
Strong team player, good interpersonal skills, with the ability to work well across teams and organisations
Self-directed, agile, and able to operate in an evolving and fast-paced environment


Position will commensurate with experience.
Only short-listed candidates will be notified.

Job Title:
New Business Analyst, APAC
- job post
Job Description:
At Wunderman Thompson, we exist to inspire growth for ambitious brands. Part creative agency, part consultancy, and part technology company, our experts provide end-to-end capabilities at a global scale to deliver inspiration across the entire brand and customer experience.

The APAC New Business Analyst is a critical role to innovate the use of data analysis for strategic business development, in supporting the delivery of our APAC growth initiatives. Working as a core member of the APAC growth team, you will be responsible for key elements of the WT APAC growth plan, by providing administrative, data analysis and operational support.

You will acquire and combine data and reports from multiple data sources across markets, teams and platforms, to produce new business analysis and insights that will inform and optimise our growth plan. You will also work closely with broader WT teams at regional level, including our Content, Commerce, Data & Tech and Experience Capability Leads and commercial leads; at a market level, including our market CEOs, key client account leads, and growth and marketing leads; and at a global level, with our APAC marketing and growth teams, global business development team and global Top 30 Client Leads.

We are seeking someone who can thrive in an analytical and creative environment where collaboration, client service, and business insights are leveraged in a strategic, data-driven approach to strength our product & service offerings and power business growth

What you’ll do
Analyse Data and Provide New Business Insights
o Collect, Manage and Analyse new business and client data from multiple markets and data sources to drive data-driven new business decisions.
o Work with markets to ensure regular and accurate reporting of new business wins and pipeline data in Salesforce and other growth and client related platforms.
o Manage commercial, growth and marketing performance reports and dashboards to uncover and highlight new insights for business growth decisions.
o Support the development of reports and strategic analysis of business processes.
o Ensure connectivity and alignment between the APAC growth and finance teams, and consistent reporting to enable greater commercial excellence.

Provide Administrative Support & Maintain Best Practice
o Identify and implement internal growth & marketing process improvements to automate or optimize manual processes and data delivery.
o Build and consolidate toolkits for best-in-class pitch responses, capability engagement, capability knowledge, creds, case studies and marketing initiatives.
o Manage the APAC section of our global SharePoint new business database and work with markets to ensure regular updates.
o Templatise pitch inputs and outputs to create greater efficiencies and streamline processes.
o Support the development of alternative solutions to streamline processes

Provide Day-to-day Operational Support
o Work with Growth & Marketing, Client, Capability and Finance teams on their new business-related requests.
o Support in coordinating and delivering tasks for regional/global pitches and key client growth projects.
o Support in delivering and tracking of growth marketing initiatives including client prospecting events and workshops.
o Support on the planning and delivery of monthly APAC growth community calls.
o Support in liaising with market, client and partner stakeholders to identify business needs.

What you’ll need
Proven experience in new business, client services, or project management experience in a similar fast-paced agency setting with great communication skills at both written and verbal.
Understand the importance of a mission critical environment and have a creative mind – you can think outside the box!
Confident in presenting insight and making recommendations at C-level, both internally and externally, for decision making and/or strategic planning.
Outstanding attention to detail, possess a sense of urgency and the ability to work on multiple projects at once.
Proven track record in an agency environment, including exposure to clients and ability to lead project teams, ability to perform and manage in changing and fast-paced environment.
Demonstrates ability to identify, prioritize, and manage project information flow. Communicate expectations to client, team members and manage the process from assessment and definition, creative & technical design, production and development, testing and launch.
Ability to present information effectively in informal and formal client settings. Demonstrates proven organizational and planning skills, must be detail oriented, have strong presentation and project management skills, excellent verbal/written communication skills, and strong facilitation skills.
Strong analytical skills related to working with multiple dataset formats and structures.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment.

Preferred Experience
Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in business, math, economics, or other analytical fields
o Working knowledge and portfolio examples of data visualizations developed in online dashboards, preferably Power BI or Tableau
Solid experience in data analysis, reporting, creating data visualization and dashboards
Broad business acumen with the ability to transfer data into insights and translate this into a compelling story
Have strong consumer-centric approach that is able to translate knowledge into insights and recommendations that meet consumer's needs today and in the future.

Location Singapore

About PTS Singapore
Our working environments are constantly evolving, and our clients are looking for engaging, exciting and human experiences in the workplace. Tech is the foundation.
As a tech design consultancy at the vanguard of design for prestigious, household name clients, PTS delights in achieving their objectives through the design and delivery of tech experiences.
You will gain invaluable experience in tech, the built environment, and personal growth through executing unique, future-looking tasks involving AI, IoT, machine learning, and multiple industries including the cutting edge of edu-and-med-tech.
Based in our Singapore office in the CBD, you will be working on cutting edge projects for prestigious, household name clients with one common goal – to be the number one design consultancy in Asia for workplace experiences underpinned by tech.
Don’t worry if you lack experience in this area, we will provide training. Our key consideration is the right attitude and a confident personality that can communicate effectively.
PTS is an Equal Opportunities employer and applicants are selected solely on the basis of their relevant aptitudes, skills and abilities. No applicant shall receive less favourable treatment on the grounds of sex, marital status, civil partnership status, trans-gender status, pregnancy, maternity, colour, race, nationality, ethnic origin, religion, belief, sexual orientation, disability, age. This is not an exclusive list.

Role Overview
Our consultants are responsible for providing professional services to PTS’ clients throughout strategy, design, procurement and implementation stages of projects.
We are looking for recruit a Junior Acoustic Consultant to further expand the consultancy team. Duties will be unique based on the project, client or industry.
You will be looking to start a career in Acoustics and be a self-motivated, hands on, ambitious with a positive attitude, a high standard of written and verbal English, with excellent interpersonal and analytical skills. You will be exposed to an Asia-wide network of industry a network of influencers and decision makers.
You will be empowered to make a difference to the Company and its team members. Are you ready to boost your career?

Responsibilities
The Junior Acoustic Consultant will:
1. Working as part of a multi-skilled team to provide acoustic related services to PTS’ clients
2. Convert client requirements from concept design to fully functional solutions
3. Represent PTS in a professional manner at all times and exercise good communication skills with the Client; other design bodies and contractors
4. Performing installation of monitoring equipment and conducting noise surveys including sound insulation testing
5. Review architectural and MEP drawings
6. Performing prediction and calculation of sound insulation and MEP noise assessment
7. Fact-checking, proof-reading, finding and organizing relevant data and performing research and analysis as required
8. Summarise results and assist in the creation of spreadsheets for analysis, and tables and charts for reports
9. Maintain accurate records of and ensure timely delivery of requests
10. Attend meetings and provide ad-hoc support to the team
11. Understand PTS business, our projects and our customers

Experience and Characteristics
Applicants must be able to demonstrate the following:
1. A self-motivated individual that can work both in isolation and in a team as necessary with effective time management
2. Unafraid to attempt new work outside of their normal “comfort-zone”
3. Honest and forthright with the ability to challenge constructively
4. A proactive and professional attitude with Methodical process orientated approach and Excellent interpersonal skills
5. Have strong organisational, Meticulous eye for detail and innovative with excellent interpersonal skills
6. Be able to command and empathise with both internal and client teams
7. Collaborate with other PTS teams (AV, physical security, Professional and Managed Services) and service lines so that a united PTS can provide a complete solution to our clients
Other Qualifications & Skills
1. Experience in building acoustic and environmental acoustic desired
2. Understand the complexities of acoustic in construction environments

4. Basic knowledge of calculation software such as SoundPLAN and Insul
5. Understanding of MS Project, MS Office and CAD Software
6. Excellent spoken and written English and able to travel Asia-wide

JOB DESCRIPTION

The number one goal of everyone in our team is to make our Clients exceptionally happy. The Senior Technical Support Consultant (Level 3) plays an important role in making sure that happens.

The Senior Technical Support Consultant (Level 3) handles escalated support requests from Technical Support Consultant (Level 2) where they can’t handle as well as any projects that require on-site implementation. When help is needed the Senior Technical Support Consultant (Level 3) can turn to the Team Leads and Technical Manager for guidance and support.

Responsible for Level 3 support and escalations for network and System issues;

About SGInnovate:
At SGInnovate, we build and scale Deep Tech startups into companies with global impact. We believe that hard global problems can be solved using Deep Tech, and Singapore, where we are based, is uniquely positioned to realise Deep Tech innovations that can tackle these challenges. Our Deep Tech Nexus Strategy is focused on adding tangible value to the Deep Tech startup ecosystem in two key areas – development of Human Capital and deployment of Investment Capital. With the support of our partners and co-investors, we back entrepreneurial scientists through equity-based investments, access to talent and business-building advice. Our efforts are prioritised around emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Autonomous Tech, MedTech and Quantum Tech, which represent impactful and scalable answers to global challenges. SGInnovate is a private-limited company wholly owned by the Singapore Government. For more information, please visit www.sginnovate.com.

Overview of Internship Scope:
The Talent team bridges talent to Deep Tech startups. We are building a talent pool and connecting these individuals to Deep Tech founders. We have a range of engagement activities which we drive, to build meaningful connections with these individuals, they can be intellectually stimulating, inspiring and most of all, fun to be at. These can include apprenticeships, development workshops, networking sessions, career fairs, etc. We want to leave a lasting impression on the attendees and encourage them to join our Deep Tech founders’ missions.
With the expansion of the Talent team, we are looking for a highly motivated individual to support the day-to-day operations of our Talent Programmes. We aim to match top talent with high-potential Deep Tech startups with projects in the fields of emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence, Cybersecurity, IoT, Robotics, Quantum Computing and more.
As a Talent Programme intern, you will be responsible to manage and support all operational and administrative matters, to ensure smooth execution of our Talent Programme. These would include:
Support the end-to-end programme management (design, implementation, review, reporting and continuous improvement of the programme to ensure strong adoption of the programme).
Work closely across SGInnovate internal stakeholders as well as with external partners (e.g. startup founders, career offices, industry experts and government agencies).
Support the candidate management process – candidate outreach activities, reviewing etc.
Plan and contribute content and messages for digital and social media, including our newsletters.
You may be a good fit if you possess:
Strong passion and interest in startups and Deep Tech (e.g. Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, MedTech, etc.)
Enjoy meeting new people and forming partnerships with others
Able to communicate, write, and present with professionalism
Great planning and implementation skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
If the above sounds like you & your dream job, send us your CV at recruitment@sginnovate.com and let's do a coffee chat.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. By submitting an application or your resume to us, you are consenting to the collection and use of the submitted personally identifiable data. We collect and use personal data (e.g. name, address, telephone number and email address) submitted by you for evaluating job applications, processing information requests, and internal record-keeping of our communications with you. Further information on our Data Protection & Privacy Policy can be found at Privacy & Cookies Policy | SGInnovate.

COMPANY BACKGROUND
Kosmode Health Singapore’s was incorporated with the mission to expand access to health from nature, as a business enabler. Anchored on a Triple Technology Platform, KosmodeHealth overcomes issues of high cost of plant health ingredients for functional food development with proprietary Plant Extraction Technology, and high cost and risk of animal protein biomaterial for biomedical applications with Plant Protein Composite (PPC™) Bio ink formulation technology and proprietary precisioncontrolled 3D bio scaffold printing methodology.
KosmodeHealth has two business verticals:
Plant Extraction & Functional Food vertical serving the Agri-food Industry &
3D Bioprinting vertical serving the 3D cell culture segment in the Biomedical Industry.
The core plant extraction expertise has been utilised to reclaim proteins and fibre from food processing spent materials. A range of protein & fibre functional food prototypes has been developed. Amongst the functional food prototypes developed, is a starchless, high fibre, protein noodles with ZERO Glycemic Index (W0W® Noodles).
Plant protein extracted has also been formulated into Plant Protein Composite (PPC™) bio-ink and that can be printed into 3D PPC™ Scaffold for 3D cells & tissue culture.
Having laid a strong foundation, KosmodeHealth is poised for business outreach and growth. As we expand our business operations, we seek talents who thrives on solving industry problems, is a resourceful, multi-tasker with the resilience and perseverance to drive success in people-centric culture where integrity is the core value and quality a given.
OVERALL JOB SCOPE
The Food Tech Intern supports Technology Lead in plant bioactive extraction, functional food production/formulation/optimization and project management of internal R&D and/or customers’ project.
SPECIFIC ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Undertake extractions of bioactive (e.g. polyphenols, proteins, fibers etc) from botanicals and food processing and/or agri-food side-streams (such as spent barley, spent coffee).
Design, formulate, manufacture functional products for commercialization.
Analysis of food compositions including micronutrients
Support development of ZERO GI functional food with upcycled materials
Project management - Plans, schedules, coordinate internal resources, liaise with third parties/vendors for the seamless execution of customers’ and R&D projects.
Perform analysis, characterization, identification of botanicals, extracts etc.
Develop/design experiments to extend shelf life, optimise production process to achieve technical and marketing specifications
Contribute to efficient end to end (production to order fulfilment) of company’s product portfolio (including but not limited to W0W® Noodles and upcycled ingredients with functional benefits)
Prepare business process reports for management and customers.
Participate in customers’ meetings and business development activities.
QUALIFICATIONS
Academic Qualification:
2nd or 3rd year Food Science & Technology undergraduate
Able to commit for at least 5 months (the part-time arrangement for month 4, 5 could be explored)
Prior experience in functional food formulation and or marketing are strong advantages.
Skills
Multitasker
Team player, with strong interpersonal & collaborative skills to work in functional matrix team and dynamic environment
Self-driven, resourceful problem solver with a ‘Can-do’ mentality
High sense of curiosity and inquisitiveness
Strong verbal and written communication skills

This position is primarily intended for an experienced individual with practical knowledge. Fresh graduates are also invited to apply and will be considered if their thesis focus has been in a highly relevant topic.

Work Scope:
Designing and performing bioprocess experiments ranging from simple flask to large laboratory-scale bioreactor systems (1L to 10L) with little supervision.
Performing bioprocess experiments in larger scale (>10L).
Operating basic Downstream Process equipment (e.g. Crossflow filtration).
Collecting representative bioprocess samples with subsequent preparation for sample characterization.
Conducting basic measurements such as OD, substrate, and product concentration.
Fixing the experimental outcomes by careful evaluation and summary of theobtained results with subsequent clear presentation of own results.
(Co-) Authoring publications.
Writing or supporting proposals.
Mentoring junior team members.
Administrative tasks as required.

The ideal candidate should have:
Minimum of a PhD in a relevant field such as biology, food science, chemistry or similar.
At least one relevant first-author publication in an international peer-reviewed journal.
Good command of written and spoken English.
Hands-on experience in microbiology with excellent knowledge of aseptic techniques.
Experience with yeast (e.g. S. cerevisiae) and E. coli.
Practical experience in lab scale fermentation (< 10L).
Experience with various basic analytical methods (HPLC,GC,spectrophotometer etc.).
Familiar with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) at a level where reports and presentations can be properly prepared.
Accuracy and care in handling and measuring samples and generating data.
Good organization and time management in planning daily work activities.
Commitment to strict compliance with established standards for safe workpractices.
Experience to develop and follow process SOPs and batch sheets, risk assessments and specifications for scale-up, and tech transfer.
Self-motivation and perseverance.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
A constant striving for further development of one's own abilities.

Advantageous but not a necessity will be:
Hands-on experience with design of experiments (DOE) applied to bioprocessesand associated software (JMP, MiniTab).
Practical experience in handling larger bioreactors (10 l to 200 l).
Knowledge of relevant large-scale industrial fermentation practices.
Practical experience with in-situ extraction methods.
Practical or theoretical experience with gas fermentation bioreactors.
Background knowledge on bioprocesses for food applications (precision fermentation, alternative proteins etc.).
Automated fermentation control strategies.
Knowledge of Downstream Processing methods as an additional focus.
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
Type of Employment : Full-Time
Work Location : Biopolis

About Sleek
Sleek is on a mission to revolutionize how entrepreneurs operate their business. We want to give small business owners peace of mind and the power of online solutions to allow them to focus on what they do best - growing their business. As we work for our thousands of customers, we gather millions of data points about their business, and in turn we transform those into useful, actionable insights and recommendations to accelerate their growth through smart algorithms.
We are a team of 250 builders from 17 countries, with offices in Singapore, Philippines, Hong Kong, Australia and the UK committed to delivering a delightful experience to our clients!
Position Duties
“Tell me and I forget, teach me and I remember, involve me and I learn.”
We offer a finance internship like no other. Being part of an in-house finance team holding most financial certifications (CA, CPA, ACCA, CFA), you will get an understanding of financial function from single document entry to strategic financial management, through statutory reporting, management reporting, modelling, business partnering and investor relationships, sometimes working on concepts that are at the fore front of financial management, exceeding industry best practices.

We need you to be highly analytical, curious and organised, interested in holistic financial management and already having a good understanding of accounting concepts. These are the tasks that we would require you to be involved in:
Assisting the finance team in financial and data analysis.
Creating dashboards, pivot tables, graphs, spreadsheet models from raw data.
Providing financial statistics.
Working on financial modeling, data cleaning & analysis, KPI tracking and process optimizations.
We will explain all the rest, give you autonomy and mentor you to become the next financial leader of Singapore. When your internship is concluded after 6 months you will hold 3 years worth of experience and dazzle your peers and market with your practical and conceptual knowledge.
Looking forward to hearing from you.
Performance Standards
Preferably accounting-trained or understudying accounting/finance/business.
Understands finance and accounting, e.g. profit and loss, balance sheet, cash flow, e.t.c
Familiar with MS Office suite and Google G Suite. In particular MS Excel and Google Sheets and able to work with more advanced formulas e.g. IF, AND, OR, SUMIFS, COUNTIFS, VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH, e.t.c
Loves working with numbers and detail-oriented.
Smart, hardworking, and a goal-getter that is not afraid to get stuff done.
Flexible and able to think on his/her feet.
Eye for accuracy.
More about Sleek!
At Sleek, we work in a fast-paced start-up environment. We have a strong culture built around our five core values: Simplicity, Loyalty, Excellence, Entrepreneurship, Kindness. As a deliberately multicultural team, our team comprises more than 18 nationalities and spoken languages.
We consider the company’s success to be a result of committed individual and team efforts, and are looking to onboard talented and creative people who want to make a difference. Corporate social responsibility is a passion, and as an equal opportunity employer we aim at making the world a better place. With a strong commitment to also make Sleek a great place to work, we offer a flexible working environment where we empower every team member to be the best they can be - regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, age or identity.
If you think you would be a good fit for our mission, we look forward to hearing from you!

Job Title:
Global Head of Incident Management
- job post
Job Description:
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

Our Trust & Safety team's commitment is to keep our online community safe. We have invested heavily in human and machine-based moderation to remove harmful content quickly and often before it reaches our general community.

As the Global Head of Incident Management, you will manage our first response to community issues, ensuring that we are responding timely and considering the broader picture of how we respond to incidents. You'll provide day-to-day leadership and priority setting for the team, review and improve processes, and handle sensitive escalations covering a wide range of issues.

It is possible that this role will be exposed to harmful content as part of the core role/as part of project/ in response to escalation requests/by chance.
Some content viewed may violate our community guidelines, which include but are not limited to bullying; hate speech; child abuse; sexual assault; torture; bestiality; self-harm; suicide; murder.

What will I be doing?
You will be providing leadership and day-to-day management of our Incident Response Team.
You will analyze incident trends, systems, and data to develop improvements to the overall escalation processes and provide recommendations for process, policy, and product improvements.
You will be handling escalations in real-time, liaising with relevant stakeholders, and driving incident resolution through to an appropriate conclusion.
You will be coordinating with global cross-functional teams including Public Policy, Legal, Product, and Engineering among others to develop solutions.
What should I bring with me?
You should have experience related to Trust & Safety.
You have experience in a leadership position in a top technology firm or equivalent with a strategic mindset, agility in responding, and strong judgment. You have extensive team management experience with both senior contributors and managers.
You have the ability to work effectively under high pressure, strong interpersonal and communication skills to engage with different teams.
You have respect for other cultures and deep empathy for users. You are eager to shape a new space within a rapidly growing and changing tech company.
You have a keen interest and acute knowledge in social media challenges, sensitivity to safety or regulatory issues, and experience with crisis management.
Your ability to work in a high tempo environment, adapt, respond to day-to-day challenges of the role.
Your resilience and commitment to self-care to manage the emotional demands of the role.
Trust & Safety recognises that keeping our platform safe for TikTok communities is no ordinary job which can be both rewarding and psychologically demanding and emotionally taxing for some. This is why we are sharing the potential hazards, risks and implications in this unique line of work from the start, so our candidates are well informed before joining.

We are committed to the wellbeing of all our employees and promise to provide comprehensive and evidence-based programs, to promote and support physical and mental wellbeing throughout each employee's journey with us. We believe that wellbeing is a relationship and that everyone has a part to play, so we work in collaboration and consultation with our employees and across our functions in order to ensure a truly person-centred, innovative and integrated approach.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities, and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.

And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
Functional Description
Decision Science colleagues will serve as a key member of the Credit and Fraud Risk organization. We seek a thought-leader and a problem-solver who can blend business, technical, and industry best practices when it comes to developing the analyses, models, and algorithms that power our customers’ digital experiences.
This critical team is responsible for managing enterprise risks throughout the customer lifecycle, across our consumer and commercial businesses, and across all our global products. We develop industry-first data capabilities, build profitable decision-making frameworks, create machine learning-powered predictive models, and improve customer servicing strategies.
Our Decision Science teams use industry leading modeling and AI practices to predict customer behavior. We develop, deploy and validate predictive models and support the use of models in economic logic to enable profitable decisions across credit, fraud, marketing and servicing optimization engines.
Responsibilities:
Work with massive amounts of digital data (Web, App, API) and sophisticated tools in an industry leading Big Data environment.
Build everything from basic reports to advanced machine learning models and algos to drive improvements to our customer’s online and mobile app experiences.

Collaborate with tech partners to test, implement and deploy modeling solutions to production system.
Develop insights into customer behavior and introduce new approaches to transform complex behavioral data into actionable information
Leverage the power of closed loop through Amex network to make decisions more intelligent and relevant
Innovate with a focus on developing newer and better approaches using big data & machine learning solutions
Qualifications:
PhDs in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Operation Research and etc.) with hands-on experience leveraging sophisticated analytical and machine learning techniques. PhD degree with practical experiences NLP is a significant plus.
Expertise in an analytical language (Python, R or the equivalent), and experience with databases (Hive, SQL, or the equivalent). Knowledge of SAS is a plus but not required.
Deep understanding of machine learning/statistical algorithms such as deep learning and boosting. Experience with data visualization is a plus
Demonstrated ability to frame business problems into mathematical programming problems, leverage external thinking and tools (from academia and/or other industries) to engineer a solution and deliver business insights.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Middleton International School is part of the EtonHouse International Education Group that is headquartered in Singapore with 120 schools spread across 12 countries .
EtonHouse schools provide high-quality education to over 15,000 students globally. Over the last 26 years, EtonHouse has been at the forefront of international education offering innovative pre-schools and K-12 schools across Asia. In the early years, an inquiry-based “ Inquire-Think-Learn ” curriculum inspired by the Reggio Emilia approach is followed. The Middleton International School also offers the highly successful International Primary Curriculum (IPC), International Middle Years Curriculum (IMYC) and the IGCSE qualification.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Job Overview:
The appointed candidate will join us in Janaury 2024 and he/she will teach A Level Subject to the High School Students as well as IGCSE for Middle Years Student. There is scope to expand and grow in this role and make a valuable contribution to curriculum development.
Job Description:
Teaching, Learning and Assessment
Prepare and implement the curriculum for students, with the goals of helping students to develop confidence and proficiency in the subject, a love of learning, as well as preparation for success in the Cambridge international exams.
Support students to build critical and creative thinking skills through inquiry, observation, and experimentation.

Interact with students using a positive, supportive, respectful and open-minded attitude, language and tone, and to support and sustain the school’s codes of conduct.
Remain alert at all times on site to the safety and well-being of the students, and on any off-site activities.
Support students’ social and emotional growth.
Encourage and provide opportunities for parents to participate in classroom experiences.
Recognise that as role models for young people, one’s own personal conduct and the example of behaviour set must be of the highest standards.
Prepare assessments, mock exams, coursework as required by the syllabus and school assessment calendar.
Other Duties
Attend and participate in staff meetings, team meetings, and other meetings as required.
Maintain regular attendance and punctuality.

Establish and maintain a positive relationship of cooperation and respect with coworkers.

Maintain an attitude of continuous personal and professional improvement.
Attend professional development workshops and trainings including, but not limited to, internal training events, and to engage constructively in systems of professional appraisal and development.

About Doctor Anywhere
Doctor Anywhere (DA) is on a mission to be the largest tech-enabled, omnichannel healthcare provider in Southeast Asia. First launched in Singapore in 2017, DA aims to bridge gaps in the healthcare ecosystem through developing innovative solutions and technologies. In 2021, DA raised SGD$88 million in Series C fundraising (August 2021) and acquired Doctor Raksa, the biggest telemedicine platform in Thailand which further strengthened our foundation for telehealth and healthcare offerings. Today, DA is present in Malaysia, Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam, Indonesia and India, serving more than 2.5 million (and growing) users across the region.
At DA, we believe in the value of innovation and collaboration. Grounded in our motto of “Keep Going, Keep Growing”, our team strives towards excellence every day, and values diversity in perspectives brought by every member. Together, we bring quality healthcare to your doorstep!

Our Mission

With tens of millions of users, hundreds of millions of downloads, 2+ billion swipes per day, 20+ million matches per day, and a presence in 190+ countries, our reach is expansive—and rapidly growing.
We work together to solve complex problems. Behind the simplicity of every match, we think deeply about human relationships, behavioral science, network economics, AI and ML, online and real-world safety, cultural nuances, loneliness, love, sex, and more.

Our Values

Member Safety: Our top priority is to build an authentic, equitable, and respectful community
Diversity: We strive to build a workplace that reflects the rich diversity of our members
Authenticity + Collaboration: We encourage authenticity to nurture a trustworthy, collaborative environment
Big Ideas: We champion and rally behind big ideas, empowering people to to think and act differently and to be unafraid of having a strong point of view
Innovation: We never stand still; we’re inspired to build for what’s next, and we must constantly innovate, experiment, and learn

We are looking for a skilled Welder to cut and join metals and other materials at our facilities or construction sites. You will operate appropriate equipment to put together mechanical structures or parts with a great deal of precision. Your job is important as it provides the foundation for strong infrastructure.
A welder must be competent in using potentially dangerous equipment following all safety precautions. The ideal candidate will also have a steady hand and great attention to detail. Knowledge of different kinds of metal and their properties is essential.
Responsibilities
Read blueprints and drawings and take or read measurements to plan layout and procedures
Determine the appropriate welding equipment or method based on requirements·
Set up components for welding according to specifications (e.g. cut material with powered saws to match measurements)
Operate angle grinders to prepare the parts that must be welded
Align components using calipers, rulers etc. and clamp pieces
Weld components using manual or semi-automatic welding equipment in various positions (vertical, horizontal or overhead)
Repair machinery and other components by welding pieces and filling gaps
Maintain equipment in a condition that does not compromise safety
Co-ordinate with fitter and supervisor for job instruction.
Requirements
Proven experience as welder
Experience using a variety of welding equipment and procedures (TIG, ARC, MIG, etc.)
Experience in using electrical or manual tools (saws, squares, calipers etc.)
Ability to read and interpret technical documents and drawings
Knowledge of relative safety standards and willingness to use protective clothing (face-shield, gloves etc.)
Proficient in English
Professional Certification (e.g. an AWS welding certificate) will be an added advantage

Why Patients Need You
Whether you are involved in the design and development of manufacturing processes for products or supporting maintenance and reliability, engineering is vital to making sure customers and patients have the medicines they need, when they need them. Working with our innovative engineering team, you'll help bring medicines to the world even faster by imagining what’s possible and taking action.
What You Will Achieve
Working with Pfizer’s dynamic engineering team, you will play a critical role in developing and modifying process formulations, methods and controls to meet desired quality standards. Your production engineering skills will help in recommending and implementing improvements, modifications or additions that will help in solving problems. You will review product requirements in terms of product development compatibility and help Pfizer determine optimum costs and schedules of production.
As an associate, your focus on the job will contribute in achieving project tasks and goals. It is your domain knowledge, commitment, collaboration and dedication that will help us achieve new milestones and patients across the globe.
How You Will Achieve It
Contribute to the completion of project milestones, organize own work to meet project task deadlines and communicate progress on scheduled projects.
Lead or support major equipment related investigations and implement equipment corrective or preventative action and performance improvements.
Organize testing associated with the development of new process technologies and the support of new product introductions and tech transfers.
Ensure integrity and compliance of data according to Standard Operating Procedures.
Coordinate all work on scheduled projects (personnel activities, documentation and outside resources).
Perform other tasks necessary to support site compliance to Center and regulatory requirements.
Support cleaning program by performing swabbing and visual inspection of equipment.
Assist in document preparation and training.
Qualifications
Must-Have
Degree in Science or Degree in Engineering, in Chemical Engineering
Demonstrated ability to provide technical solutions for complex problems through equipment and process understanding
Working knowledge of Food and Drug Administration Regulations, and Good Manufacturing Practices
Proactive, has experience with high performance teams, strong interpersonal and project management skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Microsoft Applications skills
Nice-to-Have
Demonstrated experience in a relevant manufacturing environment
Knowledge and experience with Drug Product processing and equipment
